title: Technical Sales Consultant I - III - Landmark Software & Services
full_description:
We are looking for the right people - people who want to innovate, achieve, grow and lead. We attract and retain the best talent by investing in our employees and empowering them to develop themselves and their careers. Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world's largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry.

Job Duties and Qualifications

Position Mission
Working closely with the Sales, Technical, and Services teams, the candidate is responsible for providing technical and thought leadership and to collaborate with our clients to create and engineer information management digital solutions to resolve clients' technical challenges while helping them excel their business goals by showing the clear advantage of Halliburton digital solutions across the entire asset lifecycle.

The candidate, overall, will work with customers, partners and internal teams to create detailed workflows, dataflows, deliver value stream mapping and carry out Design Thinking sessions to spark innovation and engineer creative solutions for our clients.
Halliburton Technical Sales Consultants develop deep relationships with customers to better understand their needs and business goals and expand the reach of possible solutions. Functions as a liaison between the customer and the product development and Services teams to help drive product innovation and quality.

• Position, market and drive demand and sales of Halliburton Landmark Software and Digital Solutions across Data Management, Integration and Platform technologies while supporting other domains as needed from data management requirements.
• Develop deep relationships with customers to better understand their needs and business goals and expand the reach of possible solutions.
• Work and collaborate with customers, partners and internal teams to create and engineer solutions to meet and exceed customers' expectations.
• Deliver technical presentations and/or live software and Digital Solutions demonstrations for our customers via in-person, conference calls, webinars, industry events, customer-driven events or other means of communications as needed.
• Functions as a liaison between the customer and the product development team to help drive product innovation and quality.
• Prepare or assist in technical presentations, technical proposals, and tender responses in order to ensure that the proposed solution fully meet customer's expectations, technical targets and Halliburton standards.
• Analyze customer data management challenges and the applicability of leading Cloud based innovative platform technologies for Data Foundation (Data Management), Integration Foundation using open architecture tools.
• Ability to respond to RFI's RFP's and proposals for data management requirements. This includes responding to needs for National Data Repositories, data consolidation, move to the cloud, data ingestion, data quality, data federation requirements including knowledge of OSDU (Open Subsurface Data Universe).
• Participate in public Technology Days, Trade Shows and customer specific technical events throughout the year, showcasing new technologies, new functionality, and key capabilities.
• Actively participate in highlighting innovation with White Papers and industry publications individually and co-authored material.
• Participate and provide input to Sales strategy and Operations meetings as and when required.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

• Minimum of bachelor's Engineering degree required, preferably Petroleum or Subsurface Geosciences, or Information Management.
• Minimum 10 years of Oil & Gas industry experience, in Information Management and Platform Technologies working for a major oil and gas service provider or an Operator.
• Understanding of upstream data requirements and data management for subsurface, drilling, reservoir and production data and workflows
• Understanding of advanced data analytics and data science and how they accelerate data management activities.
• Knowledge data management KPIs and their meaning associated with respective activities.
• Experience in responding to RFIs/RFPs and developing proposals.
• Good technical writing skills
• Experience with any of the following: Seismic Data Management, Borehole Data Management, Corporate Data Management systems and Cloud SaaS solutions.
• Knowledge of industry leading data management solutions below:
o OpenWorks, EDM, Recall, NDR solutions, OSDU, Petrel Studio, iEnergy Cloud, DecisionSpace® 365 SaaS solutions, DecisionSpace Data Foundation, DecisionSpace Integration Foundation.
o Other E&P data management solutions experience a plus
• Experience with AI/ML and applicability to data, ingestion, Analytics, Web services, GIS and data quality will be preferred.
• Familiarity with Cloud Service Providers and their role as partners.
• Familiarity with Cloud SaaS and PaaS platforms for data management and upstream Petro technical solutions

Soft Skills:
• Be a team player with excellent communication skills
• Be creative and innovative problem solver - thinks conceptually and 'out of the box'
• Time management and task prioritization skills
• Customer satisfaction orientation
• Achievement-oriented - focuses on delivering results.

Travel Requirements:
• Frequent travel within North America Region

title: Software Architect
full_description:
Software Architect

At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. Write the next chapter of your ABB story.

This position reports to

Digital Platform Operations Manager

Your role and responsibilities

This is a Senior Technical Leadership role in Cloud and AI platform, reporting to the Vice President in ABB Ability™ Genix - industrial analytics and artificial intelligence Platform in business area Process Automation located in Bangalore. You will be leading the Product delivery team including Plat-form Services at Ability Innovation Center (AIC), home to the largest technology and engineering pool in ABB globally and is a part of ABB Global Industries and Services Private Limited, a subsidiary of ABB. It is based in Bangalore, the silicon-valley of India. Its unique infrastructure places re-search, development, engineering, and service teams under one roof, increasing collaboration and reducing time to market, with no compromise on quality. The work model for the role is : #LI-Onsite This role is contributing to Process Automation business for Process Automation Digital division based in Bangalore, India Your responsibilities: Modern Automation of CI-CD Pipeline • Design and architect CI/CD pipelines for automated build, test, and deployment processes. • Implement automation and orchestration to streamline environment provisioning and configuration. • Incorporate security scanning, vulnerability assessments, and compliance checks into the CI/CD process. • Define & Design deployment strategies to minimize downtime and risks during software updates. • Create documentation, provide training, and facilitate knowledge transfer on CI/CD best practices and procedures. GitOps Implementation: • Define and establish GitOps practices and workflows for managing infrastructure and application deployments. • Set up Git repositories for infrastructure as code (IaC) and Kubernetes manifests. • Implement GitOps tooling (e.g., ArgoCD, Flux) for automated synchronization of Git repositories with environments. • Ensure changes to infrastructure and application configurations are managed via Git pull requests. Service Management and Developer Portal : • Integrate tools (such as Backstage.io) as a developer portal and central hub for managing services and resources. • Customize the tooling to provide a catalog of services, components, and APIs, Implement access control and authentication mechanisms to secure resources. • Integrate Developer Portal with CI/CD pipelines for service registration and documentation generation. Workflow Automation: • Develop automation scripts and workflows that leverage GitOps and Developer portals to streamline infrastructure and deployment processes. Monitoring and Reporting: • Implement monitoring and reporting features in developer portal to provide in-sights into service and deployment status. Education and Adoption: • Educate teams on GitOps, Developer Portal, and CI/CD principles and encourage their adoption.

Qualifications for the role

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related tech-nical field.
Proven experience (15+ years) in a technical leadership, working with software en-gineering teams.
Expertise in designing and architecting CI/CD pipelines for automated build, test, and deployment processes.
Experience with Git repository management and Git branching strategies.
Proficiency in automation and orchestration tools (e.g., Jenkins, Ansible, Terraform).
Knowledge of security best practices, including security scanning and compliance checks.
Strong expertise in developing automation scripts and workflows that streamline infrastructure and deployment processes.
Experience with deployment strategies such as blue-green deployments and canary releases.
Exposure to work with deployment experts in defining and establishing GitOps practices and workflows


More about us

The mission of PA Digital group within ABB Industrial Automation business is to provide next generation Artificial Intelligence enabled Industry Analytics solutions that addresses the needs of an Industry 4.0 driven ecosystem to further strengthen ABB Ability™ offerings to enable us achieve the fair share of huge market. The group will accelerate digital capabilities through a Horizontal, reusable and still Industry Rich Analytics Platform to excel in IoT and system integration, coupled with Predictive modeling and Transformative Analytics Apps and Solutions -Machine Learning enabled Analytics Platform We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory "It has come to our attention that the name of ABB is being used for asking candidates to make payments for job opportunities (interviews, offers). Please be advised that ABB makes no such requests. All our open positions are made available on our career portal for all fitting the criteria to apply. ABB does not charge any fee whatsoever for recruitment process. Please do not make payments to any individuals /entities in connection to recruitment with ABB, even if is claimed that the money is refundable. ABB is not liable for such transactions. For current open positions you can visit our career website https://global.abb/group/en/careers and apply. Please refer to detailed recruitment fraud caution notice using the link https://global.abb/group/en/careers/how-to-apply/fraud-warning"

title: Senior Software Quality Specialist
full_description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

As a Senior Software Quality Specialist here at Honeywell, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our software products. You will be responsible for designing and executing test plans, identifying and reporting defects, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software solutions. With your expertise in software testing and quality assurance, you will contribute to the success of our products and help us maintain our reputation for excellence.

You will report directly to our Quality Assurance Manager and you'll work out of our Toronto, Canada location on a hybrid work schedule.

In this role, you will impact our organization by:
- Developing and executing comprehensive test plans and test cases to ensure the quality and functionality of our software products
- Identifying and documenting software defects and working closely with development teams to resolve them
- Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, product managers, and customer support, to ensure the successful delivery of high-quality software solutions
- Participating in design and code reviews to provide input on quality and testability aspects
- Continuously improving our testing processes and methodologies to enhance efficiency and effectiveness

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

• Develop and execute comprehensive test plans and test cases
• Identify and document software defects and work with development teams to resolve them
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful software delivery
• Participate in design and code reviews
• Continuously improve testing processes and methodologies

YOU MUST HAVE

• 5+ years of experience in software quality assurance or software testing. This includes designing and executing test plans and test cases
• 3+ years of experience with Web or Mobile automated testing tools and frameworks

WE VALUE

• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a relatedfield
• Knowledge of Agile development methodologies
• Excellentproblem-solving and analytical skills
• Strong communication and collaboration skills

title: Software Development Manager
full_description:
Job Summary

If you are a Software Development Manager looking to make a major impact on software offerings developed by a premier technology organization, Emerson has a great opportunity for you! Based in Manila, you will be responsible for leading the operational performance of a team of software developers as they design, develop and maintain the award winning DeltaV Distributed Control System. DeltaV is the state of the art, flagship distributed process control system used by many of the top companies in chemical, life sciences and energy industries. It consists of a variety of rich desktop and web applications used for engineering and operating a process control system, plus real-time embedded firmware in controllers and field devices directly controlling the process. Successful applicants would be expected to enhance and maintain existing products as well as develop the next generation DeltaV system, including Edge, Mobile, and potentially AI-related products.

Emerson is a global company dedicated to making the world a better place. You will be working for a company that believes a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace contributes to the rich exchange of ideas that inspire innovation. You will have the flexibility to work 3 days a week away from the office, and you will work side by side with highly motivated people dedicated to developing award-winning products that improve the lives of our customers.

In this role, your responsibilities will be:

Get results that contribute to the organization's goals through quality work produced by team members in collaboration with Agile Release Train leaders and functional collaborators.

Engage in planning, execution, and reviews activities to guide the on time and quality delivery of work commitments.

Build a high-performing team that delivers results with strong innovative mindset by continuously developing and enhancing software development and quality technical expertise and capabilities, and knowledge areas such as edge, mobile, and network architecture.

Drive vision and purpose in team goal setting, career planning, performance evaluations, and continuous process improvement, while cultivating culture and values.

Actively contribute to the organization's strategic planning and consequently own and lead initiatives supporting business goals.

Ensure that teams are staffed effectively and efficiently for current and future business needs through hiring, talent management, and succession planning.

Guarantee availability of administrative, hardware, infrastructure and environment support the team needs.

Who You Are:

You have a track record of exceeding goals successfully and persists in accomplishing objectives despite obstacles and setbacks. You rely on a mixture of analysis, wisdom, experience, and judgment when making decisions. You create breakthroughs and symbols to rally support behind the vision. You deal comfortably with the uncertainty of change. You align employee career development goals with organizational objectives

For this Role You Will Need:

Bachelor's degree in a field related to Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Information Systems Technology

10+ years of knowledge and experience in software design, development, and quality delivery of software products using proven best practices

Strong & effective collaborators or account management experience

Has demonstrated knowledge in planning, leading, organizing and projects and manage well in an environment with competing demands. At least 4 years of team management experience

Confirmed capability to deliver results through collaboration with a highly-engaged team in constantly evolving and a fast-paced environment

Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:

Familiarity with object-oriented software analysis, design and implementation

Experience with developing software products in multiple platforms with desktop, web, mobile, and API technology stack

Knowledge or experience with using Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) or other Agile practices

Experience with ISO certified processes and audits, secure lifecycle development, and/or development of software products for use in a SIL environment

Experience with leading a team in a manner that empowers the team with clear directions while at the same time holds them accountable for results

Experience with DeltaV or related distributed control system products or technologies

Our Offer To You:

By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do.

Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets. We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees.

We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion.

We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential. We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company.

We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office.

Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities.

Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to present.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is value and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.

This philosophy is fundamental to living our company's values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson.

title: Nuclear Software/Code Developer Internship
full_description:
Information Systems Laboratories, Inc., a high-tech, employee-owned technology-development company, is seeking applicants for a Code Developer Intern in its Energy and Space Division, who will be based in the Idaho Falls, Idaho office. Remote work will be considered. ISL's Energy and Space Division provides comprehensive support to the nuclear and space industries, including, but not limited to, safety analysis and assessment of complex engineering systems, computer code development along the entire software lifecycle, waste management tracking, risk management, and development of regulatory structures and evaluation procedures. ISL applies computer programs to simulate the physical behavior of commercial nuclear power plant systems during accident conditions to analyze some of the potential complex safety issues associated with commercial nuclear reactors. The Software/Code Developer Internship position involves developing and maintaining existing nuclear safety analysis codes throughout the entire software lifecycle. This may include preparing requirements documentation, implementing modeling changes, preparing code updates and documentation, preparing test plans and reports, updating code manuals, supporting code users, troubleshooting/debugging code issues, and fulfilling distribution requests for licensed software.

This internship will present an opportunity to learn a new programming language and become more experienced in web development.

Education
This position is for a Co-Op student or student intern pursuing a B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. in Nuclear Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Physics.

Work Experience
None required.

Required Skills
Strong programming skills (a sample of past programming projects may be requested).

Understanding of object-oriented programming.

Understanding of physics and engineering concepts (e.g., thermal-hydraulics, etc.).

Strong technical writing skills.
Self-driven with good communication skills.
Works well with remote teams.

Desired Skills
Familiarity with Git, GitHub, and/or GitLab.

Programming experience in Fortran, Go, C/C++, Java, and/or Python.

Familiarity with assessment, regression, unit testing, and test-driven development.

Web development (HTML, CSS) experience

Working knowledge of mathematics important for modeling physics (e.g., linear algebra, PDEs, ODEs, etc.).

To apply please send a resume to camoruso@islinc.com

Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

Job Type: Internship

Job Location: Idaho Fall - Idaho Remote

title: Udviklingsorienteret praktikant med fokus på software
full_description:
Udviklingsorienteret praktikant med fokus på software

Hos ABB er vi dedikerede til at tackle globale udfordringer. Vores kerneværdier: omsorg, mod, nysgerrighed og samarbejde - kombineret med et fokus på mangfoldighed, inklusion og lige muligheder - er vigtige drivkræfter i vores målsætning om at give alle mulighed for at skabe bæredygtige løsninger. Det er vores historie. Gør den til din historie.

Denne stilling rapporterer til

Engineering Manager

Din rolle og dit ansvar

Er du godt i gang med din uddannelse som fx ingeniør, datamatiker, IT-teknolog eller lignende, så har vi et rigtig godt tilbud til dig - hvis du altså vil være med til at sætte standarden for fremtidens IT-systemløsninger inden for automation. I et praktikforløb hos ABB får du muligheden for, at arbejde med software. Du kommer til at skifte bekendtskab med C#, C++ eller lignende sprog. Din rolle hos ABB vil dels være i vores digitale team, hvor du vil specificere, programmere, dokumentere og teste grænseflader mellem ABB-standardprodukter og tredjepartsprodukter, og dels i det mere traditionelle procesautomatiseringsfællesskab. Du vil deltage i alle projektfaser fra brainstorming af ideer til endelig installation og/eller konfiguration. Dit praktikforløb kommer til at handle om ABB's automationsløsning 800xA. Systemet er et Distributed Control System (DCS), der giver mulighed for både at indtænke sikkerhed og ikke mindst energioptimering på store anlæg. Med andre ord, er det noget, der virkelig gør en forskel inden for bæredygtig-hed, grøn omstilling samt beskyttelse mod fjendtlige hackerangreb på fx vandforsyningen. Mere konkret bruges systemet til at styre industriel produktion af bl.a. medicin og til distribution af alt fra elektricitet til naturgas. 800xA sørger også for varme og varmt vand hos både private og industrielle fjernvarmekunder. Mulighederne er utallige. Du kommer til at være med i opgaveløsningen fra start til slut med tilhørende kundedialog og test. Vores mål er klart. Du skal lære en masse og have en spændende hverdag, hvor du hele tiden udvikler dig på basis af interessante opgaver, og hvor din indsats gør en reel og målbar forskel. Ikke noget med at være kaffehenter eller kopislave. Efter endt praktik skal du have lært nok til at kunne indgå i teamet på helt lige fod med dine fastansatte kolleger. Går det, som vi håber, er dit praktikforløb første led i en tretrinsraket. Først praktik, dernæst hovedopgave i samarbejde med os og så direkte ud i en fast stilling. Du skal også vide, at ABB er din indgang til et utal af karrieremuligheder, uanset om du vil specialisere dig, skifte retning, gå ledervejen eller arbejde internationalt. Vi har kolleger, der er på deres 12. nye job i ABB. Vi har selvfølgelig et godt introprogram klar til dig, og du får fra første dag din egen mentor, som du kan sparre med. Du er ligeså selvfølgeligt med i alle vores sociale arrangementer. Det kan være alt fra fredagsøl med teamet til jule- og påskefrokost, oktoberfest, grillaftener og meget andet. Din nye arbejdsplads er ABB's kontor i Middelfart, hvor du bliver del af vores engineering-afdeling. Stemningen er god, og dine erfarne kolleger er altid klar til at hjælpe og sparre. Du har første dag omkring 1. februar 2025 og forløbet varer ca. et halvt år afhængigt af din uddannelse. Dine ansvarsområder: • Bidrage til igangværende udviklingsprojekter af desktop- eller web-applikationer, hvor dine evner inden for f.eks. C#, WPF, ASP.NET, Blazor eller SQL kan komme i spil • Tilsikre tilstrækkelig kvalitet gennem tests, jo mere automatiseret, des bedre • Benytte værktøjer såsom Azure DevOps / Git til samarbejde med resten af teamet • Installation og konfiguration af vore egne løsninger på kundens anlæg

Kvalifikationer til rollen

I gang med en teknisk uddannelse som ingeniør, datamatiker, IT-teknolog eller lignende
Stor lyst til at lære nyt og udvikle dine evner
Motivation for at få ansvar og modet til at prøve ting af på egen hånd - løbe med bolden
Mod til at opsøge de rigtige folk, hvis du mangler viden for at kunne løse en opgave
Evne for at planlægge, så du kan levere som aftalt/overholde deadlines
Forståelse for det nødvendige kvalitetsniveau - hvis en Fiat er nok, skal du ikke levere en Rolls Royce


Mere om os

Vi afholder samtaler løbende, så søg praktikken hurtigst muligt. Har du spørgsmål inden da, så kontakt meget gerne Digital Delivery Manager, Jesper Bolding på 2649 2940. Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig. Vi værdsætter mennesker med forskellige baggrunde. Kunne det her være din historie? Ansøg i dag eller besøg www.abb.com for at læse mere om os og lære om betydningen af vores løsninger over hele verden. #MyABBStory

title: Sales Manager Gas Software Solutions
full_description:
If you are an experienced Software Sales Manager looking for an opportunity to grow, Emerson has an exciting opportunity for you!

In this critical role, you will be responsible for generating sales opportunities in order to win new business to support our software solutions product lines for the Natural Gas industry. This includes leak detection, scheduling, as well as volumetric accounting (Order-to-Cash) software solutions. Our customers transport and store liquid and gas hydrocarbons and chemicals in a vast network of terminals throughout the US. The ideal candidate is a tenacious self-starter who can quickly learn the products and sell them. The sales cycle within this space can be from 6 months to 2 years.

In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:
Researching Natural Gas prospective customers' headquarters and identify high level executives within the organizations
Strategically pursuing new customers who have not done business with Emerson before
Expertly identifying the needs and opportunities to provide solutions
Communicating and making strong connections with C-level and VP-level executives
Listening to customers in a consultative manner while and defining solutions to sell our software and implementation services
Demonstrating agility to work multiple threads at the same time
Effectively applying the hunter (acquisition) and farmer (retention) methods of solution selling
Getting results, contacting prospects (sometimes through cold calls), and building relationships.

Who You Are:

You ask the right questions to accurately analyze situations. You build and deliver solutions to meet customer expectations. You effectively communicate in various settings: one-on-one, small and large groups, or among diverse styles and position levels. You break down objectives into appropriate initiatives and actions.

For this Role You Will Need:
Bachelor's Degree
10+ years of related professional experience with 5+ years' sales experience to the Oil and Gas market, specifically in the Natural Gas industry
Proficient in selling software licenses and implementation services
Proven track record selling at 'C' Level and Senior Management Levels
Proven track record working with technical resources and sales management
Willingness to travel up to 30% domestically
Legal authorization to work in the US without sponsorship now or in the future.

Preferred Qualifications That Set You Apart:
Bachelor's Degree in a Technical or Engineering field
MBA
Experience in the natural gas industry, preferably in the transportation (pipelines and storage) space
Familiarity with enterprise software implementations involving multiple departments.


Our Offer To You

Our compensation philosophy is simple: we pay a competitive base salary, within the local market in which we operate, and reward performance during the annual merit review process. The salary range for this role is $100,000 - 150,000 annually, commensurate with the skills, talent capabilities, and experience each candidate brings to this role. This role will also be eligible for additional bonus, based on Emerson's sales and commission guidelines.

We recognize the importance of employee wellbeing and know that to do your best you must have flexible, competitive benefit plans to meet you and your family's physical, mental, financial, and social needs. We provide a variety of medical insurance plans, with dental and vision coverage. Employee Assistance Program, profit sharing, tuition reimbursement, employee resource groups, recognition, and much more. Our culture prioritizes work-life balance and offers flexible time off plans, including paid parental leave (maternal and paternal), vacation and holiday leave.

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that encourage innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.

The philosophy is fundamental to living our company's values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion at Emerson.

Our training programs and initiatives focus on end-to end development, from onboarding through senior leadership. We provide a wide range of development opportunities, including face-to-face and virtual training, mentorship, and coaching, project management, and on-the-job training.

#LI-Remote

#LI-SD1

ABOUT US

WHY EMERSON

Our Commitment to Our People

At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration.

We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world's most complex problems - for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You'll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor.

At Emerson, you'll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let's go. Let's think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let's go, together.

Work Authorization

Emerson will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1(including those with OPT or CPT) , H-1, H-2, L-1, B, J or TN, or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Emerson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, marital status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status. We are committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment.

Accessibility Assistance or Accommodation

If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com.

ABOUT EMERSON

Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability.

With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety.

We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you're an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you'll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team - let's go!

No calls or agencies please.

title: Oil, Bio & Shipping - AI Research in Software Development Solutions - Internship
full_description:
Context & Environment

Internship Topic: "How AI can assist in the development of software solutions"

Location: Geneva

Duration: 6 months internship

Desired start date: Q1 2025

You have an IT engineering background; solid programming skills, and you are curious and dynamic?

To support TotalEnergies's ambitions and growth, the business unit "Oil, Bio & Shipping" (OBS) is looking to hire its next intern.

About us

TotalEnergies has developed a strong expertise in oil and biofuels, natural gas and electricity trading. Trading entities are based in Geneva, Paris, Houston, Dubai, and Singapore.

In a rapidly changing energy environment (technology & digital solutions, new energies, alternative mobility, collaborative economy, etc.), innovation is of major importance to ensure future market competitiveness. Implementing advanced technologies and making internal and external processes more reliable is key to our ambition to be a leading trader in the energy sector.

Our Culture

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development, and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Context and environment

You will work in the business unit "Oil, Bio & Shipping" of the IT department. Our domain of responsibility is the development, and the management of the information systems used by the front office, the middle office, the trading operations, and the shipping users in order to support them to achieve their objectives. Consequently, the ETRM (Energy Trading and Risk Management) system is part of our responsibility.

Activities

What you will do:

The aim of this research internship is to explore how artificial intelligence can be used to enhance software development. You will have access to advanced tools like Claude and Copilot to conduct your research. Areas of study may include:
Analyze the existing situation: Work closely with all the OBS teams to audit the current processes (BA, development, QA, RPA, etc.) to identify strengths and gaps and to understand how each field can be improved.
State-of-the-art study: Analyze the latest publications and trends in AI applied to software development and identify AI tools and frameworks relevant for each team objectives.
Prototype development:It is a project with a wide spectrum where all ideas can be analyzed as for example:
Code generation: Improve the way to feed AI prompt to improve code generation
Quality analysis: Support the quality analysis by proposing relevant unit tests
Preventive maintenance: Alert when code becomes obsolete, etc...
Evaluation and optimization: Use various AI solutions according to their specific features, potentially chaining them together. Aim to create end-to-end solutions with minimal human intervention (where no added value is provided by human action).
Documentation and reporting: Document each step of the research and the implementation. Present the results to the relevant teams and propose improvements. Make recommendations for potential future implementations.

Candidate Profile

Your Profile
In the course of higher education in computer science (Master / School of Engineers) with a specialization in AI;
You are dynamic, methodical, rigorous and curious; you like working as a team
You have good communication skills;
You are autonomous, and you have a particular appetite for activities around data and computer development.
Knowledge of artificial intelligences tools such as ChatGPT, Claude and Copilot.
Good development skills in Python and JS (other languages could be a nice to have);
English essential.
A tri-partite internship agreement is mandatory

At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees' fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.
Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any other protected group status. Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We will provide necessary accommodations upon request.

Additional Information

TotalEnergies values diversity, promotes individual growth and offers equal opportunity careers.

TotalEnergies is a broad energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people
Trading Shipping :
Give your best to better energy and make the commitment with TotalEnergies. We are one of the most active players in the international oil markets, trading with a vast network of customers and suppliers worldwide: national oil companies, producers, other oil majors, refiners, traders, distributors and end-users.
We have developed a set of trading strategies and expertise, which allows us to respond permanently to market changes and opportunities, on all physical and paper oil markets.
Satisfying the energy needs of a growing world population, curbing global warming, and adapting to changing customer behaviors and expectations are the three challenges that TotalEnergies must meet over the next 20 years. With its biomass blending and trading activity, TotalEnergies Trading & Shipping is an active participant in the development of sustainable biofuels. title: Software Developer
full_description:
Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. We help customers in critical industries, like energy, chemical, power and renewables, life sciences and factory automation, operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability.

Join our global development team and build the future of industrial vibration analysis!

If you are eager to make a step forward in your career, we look forward to seeing your application!

In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:

• Analyzing customer needs to identify software solutions.
• Crafting intuitive user interfaces and architecting robust system designs.
• Developing clean and efficient application code.
• Writing comprehensive unit and integration tests.
• Thoroughly testing applications to ensure quality.
• Profiling and optimizing applications for performance.
• Crafting developer tools to streamline and improve workflows.
• Contributing to the refinement of software development processes.
• Participating in code reviews to maintain high standards while collaborating efficiently within a multi-functional team.

Who You Are:

You anticipate the impact of emerging technologies and make vital adjustments. Technology Stack: Kotlin, Jetpack Compose, Dependency Injection, Coroutines, Android

Experience working in an Agile Scrum team
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Proactive behavior and a passion for technology

Passionate about automation and good understand of mobile application.


Our Offer To You:

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. From competitive benefits plans and comprehensive medical care to equitable opportunities for growth and development we strive to create a workplace that is supportive and rewarding. Our work schedule aims at creating new levels of growth, build a stronger community and provide greater professional development for our employees.

Make this great opportunity yours!

Our Commitment to Our People

At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration.

We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world's most complex problems - for our customers, our communities, and the planet. title: Sr. Business Manager, Software Operations & Analytics
full_description:
Emerson's T&M Test Software team is seeking a Sr. Business Manager, Operations & Analytics, to be our trusted advisor for delivery of actionable insights that serve as a catalyst for change and growth for the company. This role will directly support the Software leadership team and analyzing financial performance, market and customer base, and product portfolio in support of T&M's Test Software business, while interlocking with Operations, Sales, Marketing, Finance, IT, and R&D. This individual will play a critical role in developing foundational datasets and metrics, and ensuring our data infrastructure supports robust analytical capabilities.

In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:
Serves as the trusted expert for Software Business Analytics
Demonstrates a deep understanding of software business strategies, processes, operations, and the resulting data that is needed to drive improvements.
Directs efforts to improve efficiency of reporting and presentations, guiding team(s) to ensure presented results are actionable, accurate, and easily understood
Builds partnerships with business collaborators and team members, proactively exploring business needs and driving complex analyses to address business questions
Partners with other analytics leads to create data products that are adopted to support Software Business analytics across Emerson T&M
Directs teams to determine business factors and related data sources that should be used to evaluate the impact of business, product, and/or operational decisions
Holds teams accountable for evaluating risks and limitations, ensuring recommendations are actionable, and clearly articulating connections between results, recommendations, and business needs
Establishes and leverages working relationships across teams to ensure quality of data sources and drive towards a single-source-of-truth for all cross-functional datasets
Identifies and engages collaborators from across the organization to address short- and long- term business needs, and drives engagements to address them.
Interacts with business leaders to identify and define key issues, gather requirements, design and develop insight solutions, communicate findings and make recommendations
Acts as an inspiring leader, proposing innovative analytical solutions to solve business challenges

Who You Are:

You are a leader who is self- driven, shows tremendous amount of initiative and gracefully handles ambiguity. You possess strong leadership and skills and have a consistent track record of developing and implementing strategies to achieve organizational objectives.

For This Role, You Will Need:
BE/BTech degree in a relevant field.
8+ years of successful business operations, software product management, business development, and/or analytics and reporting experience
4+ years' experience building and/or managing teams that build analytical reports (Power BI, Tableau)Strong communication & people skills, with experience working cross-functional teams in support of Sr. Leadership, key business forums, and division objectives
Proven experience working in a dynamic environment, be comfortable with ambiguity, and demonstrate ability to devise and implement project plans aligned with business objectives
Proven ability guiding teams on organizing and analyzing large disparate data sets,

Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:
Experience with database and programming tools like Snowflake, DBT, Qubole (Hive/Spark/Presto), Python, R, are a plus

Our Offer To You:

By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do.

Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets. We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees.

We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential. We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company.

We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office.

Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities.

Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.

This philosophy is fundamental to living our company's values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson.

title: Sr Advanced Software Engr
full_description:

Be part of a team that designs, develops and integrates highly complex software functions within Honeywell. You will use your experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. You will work with Product Managers to evaluate the product Roadmap to identify features for development and identify "deﬁnition of done" for each feature

title: Sr Staff Software Architect
company: GE Renewable Energy Power and Aviation
full_description:
Job Description Summary

This role will be responsible advanced software development for critical Engineering tools used within GE Aerospace, including coaching and mentoring members of the software team. This role will involve working independently and contributing to the immediate team and to other teams across the business. This role will also lead design discussions, and drive team efficiency through agile/scrum and DevOps methodologies. This role is focused on the Project and Portfolio Management (PPM) domain, which makes use of Deltek Open Plan and Cobra, among other tools.

Abilities:
Drives software design and implementation of the software roadmap, and drives the team decisions.
Design and develop complex application software code in multiple languages.
Develop reusable code pipelines through CI/CD. Developing and executing integrated test plans.
Coach and mentor to develop team members. Collaborate across the site to leverage and share best practices.

Job Description

Essential Responsibilities:

In this role, you will:
• Lead and coordinate the domain technical and business discussions relative to future architecture direction across the product portfolio or product line.
• Analyze design and develop a roadmap and implementation plan based upon a current vs. future state in a cohesive architecture viewpoint.
• Review and/or analyze and develop architectural requirements at domain level within product portfolio or team.
• Participate in the enterprise architecture domain governance model.
• Contribute to the development of software and data delivery platforms with reusable components that can be orchestrated together into different methods.
• Lead the research and evaluation of emerging technology, industry and market trends to assist in project development and/or operational support actives.

Qualifications/Requirements:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or "STEM" Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math) with significant experience.

Desired Characteristics:

Desired Skills:

Experience with Deltek Open Plan and/or Cobra. 2+ years of experience using the COTS tool API's. Experience with Microsoft Project. Understanding of cybersecurity, Aerospace (DO-178), CMMC, and/or Export Control regulations. Advanced Jenkins automation or other CI/CD experience. 3+ years of scrum/agile experience. Advanced JAVA and/or Python development experience. Expert level communication skills.
Humble: respectful, receptive, agile, eager to learn
Transparent: shares critical information, speaks with candor, contributes constructively
Focused: quick learner, strategically prioritizes work, committed
Leadership ability: strong communicator, decision-maker, collaborative
Problem solver: analytical-minded, challenges existing processes, critical thinker


Soft Skills:

• Change Agent - Identifies opportunities for necessary changes and pursues/leads them when appropriate. Evaluates progress and involves peers and team members in analyzing strengths and weaknesses in performance. Works with executive stakeholders to embrace the implications of change. Recommends changes that impact strategic business direction. Leads the planning and implementation of change programs that impact critical processes. Subdivides major deliverables into smaller, manageable components and re-appropriates existing solutions to new requirements and situations. Innovates and integrates new processes and/or technology to add value to GE. Identifies how the cost of change weighs against the benefits and advises accordingly. Proactively learns new solutions and processes to address problems.

• Collaboration - Establishes & communicates team members' roles in relation to their function and data. Shares knowledge, power and credit, establishing trust, credibility, and goodwill. Coordinates role responsibilities with that of others to achieve mutual goals. Encourages groups to work together to resolve problems. Proactively coaches and/or mentors others to improve their contribution to the team. Fosters relationship building between team members and those outside the team. Works with others to achieve goals without regard to band/title. Identifies gaps in roles on teams, and is recognized for growing and distributing talent pools across the organization.

• Comfort in Ambiguity - Acts and decides appropriately when all available information may not be possible to obtain. Makes decisions and course corrects as a result of the feedback from those decisions. Presents results with alternatives and scenarios. Creates new tools and methods for gaining data and driving clarity. Supports the team to drive through ambiguity.

• Communication - Creates stories and utilizes two-way communications. Communicates functional strategy and roadmap with detail for teams to utilize. Describes functional area information to leaders. Coaches others on presentation skills. Collaborates with leadership on mediums and messages that drive the intended direction of the organization with measurable results. Determines the need for theoretical explanations vs. a business actionable answer in a presentation.

• Consulting - Provides options and counsel. Drives dialogues that produce new perspectives and substantial innovation, enhancements and analysis of consequences. Consults on projects to fit systems or infrastructure, and project goals to their function, and vice versa. Provides risk-assessed options in relation to process enhancement and professional expertise. Consults on data or data infrastructure development projects and identifies when necessary to modify the solution.

• Curiosity/Creativity - Connects ideas and solutions from a broad array of sources (e.g., what other businesses are doing, brainstorming with others). Pilots new ideas and processes that have not been utilized before.

• Decision Making & Risk Management - Participates in the creation of company-wide risk management strategies. Works with senior business leaders to communicate risks, impact, and mitigation plans for the business. Applies best practices to take calculated risks. Takes risks and learns from failures. Encourages ideas from others that may include risk but may provide great gains for the organization.

• Influence - Influences through others, including by use of experts or other third parties. Builds direct and ""behind the scenes"" support for ideas. Foresees downstream consequences and tailors communication strategy to support a positive outcome.

• Problem Solving - Identifies future roadblocks and promotes data-based problem solving. Assesses & prioritizes problems in relation to organizational goals. Coordinates team's work and performance with broader organizational objectives and manages conflicts between them. Advises others in how to solve difficult problems.

Note

This Job Description is intended to provide a high level guide to the role. However, it is not intended to amend or otherwise restrict/expand the duties required from each individual employee as set out in their respective employment contract and/or as otherwise agreed between an employee and their manager.

Additional Job D escription

Additional Information

Compensation Grade

SPB3

Relocation Assistance Provided: No

title: Product Owner Leitungsbau Software (m/w/d) (Dortmund, DE)
full_description:
Westnetz GmbH | Unbefristet | Vollzeit; Teilzeit | Hybrid

Du. Mit uns? Für unser Team Leitungstechnik am Standort Dortmund (ggf. auch andere wohnortnahe Westnetz-Standorte möglich) suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt engagierte Verstärkung.

Deine Arbeit sollte sinnstiftend sein und Du willst Dich mit all Deinen Facetten einbringen? Dann bist Du bei uns richtig. Wie Du bist, was Du fühlst: Wir sehen Dich.

Die Westnetz GmbH , eine 100-prozentige Tochter der Westenergie AG, ist der größte Verteilnetzbetreiber Deutschlands. Mit über 6.000 Mitarbeiter*innen und unserer offenen Unternehmenskultur stellen wir die zuverlässige Versorgung unserer Kundinnen und Kunden sicher - rund um die Uhr, an 365 Tagen im Jahr. Wenn Du mit uns die Energiewende mitgestalten, die Lebensqualität von Menschen verbessern und die regionale Infrastruktur stärken willst, findest Du bei uns Raum zur Verwirklichung.

Der Bereich Leitungen bündelt das fachliche Know-how für Freileitungen und Kabel im 110 kV Hochspannungsnetz. Im Fokus steht dabei die Umsetzung von Neubau- und Umbaumaßnahmen im gesamten Hochspannungsnetz der Westnetz, weiterer E.ON-Konzerngesellschaften sowie für externe Kunden.

Dafür stehst Du auf:

Du bist verantwortlich für die Weiterentwicklung und Prozessintegration unserer Software im Leitungsbau und fungierst als Schnittstelle zwischen Benutzern, Softwareentwicklern und dem Infrastruktur-/Betriebsteam.
Du analysierst und bewertest Geschäftsprozesse, identifizierst Schwachstellen und Optimierungspotentiale und arbeitest kontinuierlich an der Verbesserung unserer Produkte.
Du arbeitest eng mit Stakeholdern, Projektleitern und dem Entwicklungsteam zusammen, um die Produkt- und Prozessvision zu verstehen und in konkrete Anforderungen umzusetzen.
Du erstellst und pflegst das Produkt-Backlog und priorisierst die Anforderungen.
Du unterstützt und entwickelst den Fachbereich in diversen IT-technischen Belangen.


Das bringst Du mit:
Du hast ein abgeschlossenes (Fach-)Hochschulstudium in einem relevanten Bereich wie Informatik, Energie-/Elektrotechnik oder Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation bzw. Berufserfahrung.
Idealerweise bringst Du Erfahrung in der Analyse und Optimierung von Geschäftsprozessen, der agilen Produktentwicklung und IT-Servicemanagement mit.
Erfahrung mit der FM-Produktfamilie und/oder leitungsbautechnischen Prozessen ist von Vorteil.
Du bringst Menschen aus verschiedenen Fachgebieten und Teams zusammen, um die Themen- und Produktentwicklung voranzutreiben.
Du treibst Verbesserungen voran, um gesunde Arbeitssituationen zu schaffen.
Du strebst hohe Kundenzufriedenheit an, ohne dabei die Unternehmensinteressen aus dem Blick zu verlieren.
Du bist in der Lage komplexe Sachverhalte zu analysieren und mit Prozessen zu verknüpfen.
Du förderst die Zusammenarbeit aktiv, durch Einbindung aller Beteiligten.


Das bieten wir Dir:
Deine Work-Life-Balance ist uns wichtig! Daher gibt es bei uns flexible Arbeitszeiten sowie 30 Tage Jahresurlaub. Bei uns kannst Du außerdem Dein "Home" zum "Office" machen, um noch flexibler zu werden.
Unser Tarifvertrag bietet Sicherheit: Wir bieten Dir eine attraktive Vergütung sowie viele Zusatzleistungen: Weihnachtsgeld, Zuschuss zum Krankengeld, eine Unfallversicherung und eine betriebliche Altersversorgung.
Ein abwechslungsreiches Aufgabenfeld beim größten Verteilnetzbetreiber Deutschlands, ergänzt durch genügend Freiraum für eigenverantwortliches, selbstbestimmtes und kreatives Arbeiten.
Wenn es um den Erfolg im Job geht, ist die Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie für viele entscheidend. Westnetz steht Dir dabei als zertifizierter familienfreundlicher Arbeitgeber in unterschiedlichen Lebenslagen zur Seite.


Informiere Dich hier über unsere attraktiven Unternehmensleistungen:
www.westnetz.de/arbeitgeberleistungen

Bist Du interessiert?
Dann bewirb Dich bitte ausschließlich online (Anzeigencode: 230409).

Mit unserer offenen und wertschätzenden Unternehmenskultur heißen wir alle Menschen willkommen. Denn wir sind davon überzeugt, dass uns Unterschiede bereichern - sei es in Herkunft, Geschlecht, Alter, Lebens- und Arbeitsstilen, Talenten, Fähigkeiten und Einschränkungen.

Wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung mit Lebenslauf und relevanten Zeugnissen. Um Dir den Bewerbungsprozess zu erleichtern, verzichten wir auf ein Anschreiben.

Westnetz GmbH , Patrick Nosthoff, Tel. +49 231 438 2008
Deine Fragen beantworten wir auch gerne unter p.nosthoff@westnetz.de

Wir sind ein Top-Arbeitgeber!

title: Senior Project Manager - Natural Gas Software
full_description:
Sr. Project Manager - Natural Gas Software

Trellis Energy, a subsidiary of Blackstone Technology Group, is hiring a full-time Sr. Project Manager. In this role you will lead customer implementations of our software solution Trellis, Blackstone's Natural Gas Pipeline Management Product. The Sr. Project Manager will meet with Trellis customers to understand their business requirements and will be the customer's liaison to the Trellis Development Team and executive team. You will be responsible for the on-time and on-budget delivery of Trellis implementations.

Location: Houston preferred. Our team works in a hybrid model going into our Galleria office 1 day/week. 100% remote candidates will be considered with directly applicable industry experience.

Trellis Energy Background:

Trellis Energy (trellisenergy.com) is an innovative San Francisco-based technology company offering the first SaaS B2B marketplace, to transform the commercial operations across the natural gas value chain.

Responsibilities:
Acquire detailed product knowledge of Trellis to execute and successfully deliver customer implementations.
Communicate with clients on their business processes and requirements both as they relate to Trellis and future strategic initiatives
Work with customers and internal teams in implementing Trellis to accomplish client's objectives.
Managing all aspects of the implementation lifecycle including requirements gathering, fit-gap analysis, software configuration, customer training, user acceptance testing, deployment and stabilization.
Collaborate with the product and strategy teams for detailed design and development of client specific customizations.
Create and manage well-structured statements of work (SOWs), project resources, project plans, as well as manage project risk, issues, scope, timelines and budget.
Exhibit excellent communication and leadership skills to establish a common understanding of project timelines, milestones and delivery expectations across all internal and external stakeholders.
Provide direction to project resources, monitor project progress and efforts, assemble key project deliverables and identify issues that require escalation.
Schedule and facilitate internal, external and joint project status meetings and advise management on the effects that change requests will have on schedule and resources.
Motivate and build teams who are dedicated to project delivery.
Provide product feedback (customer requirements, product shortcomings, enhancements, etc.) to product team.
Own outcomes for successful client implementations, relationships and Trellis as a product and company.

Qualifications:
5 years of natural gas / energy software consulting experience with full software implementation lifecycle experience.
7 years of specific Project Management based experience; Sr. level PMs & leaders are encouraged to apply.
Bachelor's degree is required.
Ability to work creatively and analytically in a fast paced problem-solving environment.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills.
Ability to contribute to a high-performing, motivated work-group by applying interpersonal and collaboration skills to achieve project goals and realize value for our clients.
A strong work ethic and sense of commitment to excellent outcomes for our clients and Trellis.
Must possess and exude a strong, professional demeanor and presence.
Impeccable time management skills.
Ability to lead others and an eagerness to contribute within a team-oriented environment.
Facilitation of and participate in Business Development activities.
An ability to mentor and coach others along career path and client delivery lines.
Demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Must be willing to travel up to 25% on average.
Preferred Experience with Agile Methodology.

Blackstone offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package; the company pays 100% of Employee's health insurance premiums.

#Work4BTG

title: Software Renewals Specialist
full_description:
Let's join out team as a new Software Renevals Specialist! Be part of our successfull team and gain more experiences in the field of Sales. You have affinity to IT products? Don't be left behind, feel free to apply!

In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:

title: Senior Software Developer
full_description:
Job Summary :

If you are a Senior Software Engineer professional looking for an opportunity to grow, Emerson has an exciting opportunity for you! Based in our Pune, India location, you will design and develop Emerson's Real-Time Modeling and Scheduling platform. You will also be involved in developing integrations with other Emerson products like Delta-V, write new features and maintain the code base for these systems. This is a hands-on development role working across all parts of the platform. We need an individual who can switch gears and jump between platforms as well as tasks to meet our product, bugs, and feature priorities. In this role, you will be responsible to design, build, test and deploy solutions that meet our customer needs. This role interacts closely with our professional services team to support our existing clients on bugs and new features. Additional responsibilities include testing new features/enhancements, participating in architecture sessions with our senior engineers, and creating documentation for the software.

In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:
Grasp in detail User Stories understanding customer needs and customer value
Design, develop and test the integrations between Real-Time modeling system (RTMS) and Emerson's major engineering platforms like Delta-V and Plantweb Optics
Work with inhouse professional services to understand client needs and develop features/solutions.
Work with the software development team to design, architect and develop new solutions.
Build automated test for new product features and enhancements in increase the robustness of the solution.
Provide technical leadership and experience to the team
Cultivate culture of innovation and disciplined software engineering practices to deliver business value
Write documentation for technical or non-technical users

Who you are:

You establish clear responsibilities and processes for monitoring work and measuring results. You analyze multiple and diverse sources of information to define problems accurately before moving to solutions. You make sound decisions, even in the absence of complete information. You relate comfortably with people across levels, functions, cultures, and geography.

For This Role, You Will Need :
Bachelor of Science in Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent
Be able and willing to learn new technologies to meet the needs of the organization
6+ years in industry experience
Work experience on a shipped multi-version revenue generating product
Demonstrate proficiency in .NET and C#, Asp.net or Winform.
Good knowledge and proficiency in HTML, JS, CSS and front-end frameworks like Angular, React, Vue or Lit(web components)
Proficiency in software design patterns and how to effectively apply them
Proficiency in design systems for computing intensive solutions
Proficiency in various database software like SQL Server and Oracle
Good knowledge and proficiency in backend development such as NodeJS, C#, Go
Proficiency in Software Unit Testing
Proficiency in resource design for API design
Experience in Dynamic Web Apps for delivering improved UX.
Detail-oriented and committed to quality
Ability to devise solutions to problems independently
Excellent communication skills and strong time management

Preferred education, experience & skills:
Experience with DevExpress Libraries
Experience with non-Microsoft SQL databases
Experience with Manufacturing Engineering Systems (MES)
Good experience with software development in Azure and other cloud technologies
Experience with developing Windows services
Good understanding on CI/CD, UX, Docker and Kubernetes.
Good understanding of Micro-frontend and Microservices architecture

Our Offer to You:

By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do. Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets. We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees. We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office. Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities. Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent.

title: Staff Software Developer
full_description:
If you are a Staff Software Developer looking for an opportunity to grow, Emerson has an opening for you! Based in our Austin, TX location, you will be welcomed into a diverse community and work as a member of one of the multi-functional agile teams responsible for the development of DeltaV. DeltaV is the state of the art, flagship distributed process control system used by many of the top companies in chemical, life sciences and energy industries. It consists of a variety of rich desktop and web applications used for engineering and operating a process control system, plus real-time embedded firmware in controllers and field devices directly controlling the process. Successful applicants would be expected to enhance and maintain existing products as well as develop and test the next generation of DeltaV. Come join us!

This role has the flexibility of a work-from-home option up to three days a week. Our teams work together to ensure our chosen work schedules enable our creativity and productivity as we serve the needs of our customers.

IN THIS ROLE, YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL BE:
Collaborate - Foster a creative atmosphere, review and provide detailed feedback on peers' design and code and participate in agile activities like sprint planning and retrospectives. Take part in Hackathons, Tech-talks, and Communities of Practice with like-minded people.
Innovate - Develop technologies to maintain our market leadership using the latest tools and frameworks. Write software in accordance with requirements and specifications and use standard processes to build in high-quality. Debug and validate software issues on the latest and greatest unreleased products as well as those encountered by customers.
Automate - Write automated unit tests and system level tests to continue building our automation pipeline and a release-ready product.
Iterate - Help the scrum team continuously improve its environment and processes.


WHO YOU ARE: You stay on top of new technologies and look for ways to apply it. You show a tremendous amount of initiative in tough situations and are exceptional at spotting and seizing opportunities. You enjoy the challenge of unfamiliar tasks. You deliver messages in a clear, compelling, and concise manner.

FOR THIS ROLE, YOU WILL NEED:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related engineering degree AND 9 or more years of relevant work experience
OR Master's degree in Computer Science or related engineering degree AND 8 or more years of relevant work experience
Demonstrate strong proficiency with C++, object-oriented design, data structures, and multi-threaded applications
Experience using Microsoft development tools and the Windows OS
Experience developing low-latency applications in an RTOS/embedded Linux environment
Demonstrate debugging experience about memory leaks, using standard Linux performance tools
Demonstrate experience with virtualization technologies and hypervisors
Demonstrate good communication and problem-solving skills
Knowledge of scheduling algorithms, interrupt handling, and kernel debugging and tracing tools
Legal authorization to work in the United States without sponsorship now or in the future


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS THAT SET YOU APART:
Familiarity with Windows or C# development
Experience with microservices based application architecture including containerization and orchestration
Familiarity/experience using Microsoft development tools and the Windows OS
Understanding or experience with Process Control of Distributed Control Systems (DCS)
Familiarity with Agile development using Scrum or the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe)
Familiarity with Git-based source control
Experience in developing automated unit and/or end-to-end software tests


OUR OFFER TO YOU:

We recognize the importance of employee wellbeing and know that to do your best you must have flexible, competitive benefit plans to meet you and your family's physical, mental, financial, and social needs. We provide a variety of medical insurance plans, with dental and vision coverage. Employee Assistance Program, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, employee resource groups, recognition, and much more. Our culture prioritizes work-life balance and offers flexible time off plans, including paid parental leave (maternal and paternal), vacation and holiday leave.

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspire innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.

The philosophy is fundamental to living our company's values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion at Emerson.

Our training programs and initiatives focus on end-to end development, from onboarding through senior leadership. We provide a wide range of development opportunities, including face-to-face and virtual training, mentorship, and coaching, project management, and on-the-job training.
