title: Power Systems Engineer II / III - Interconnection Studies
full_description:
About Revamp:

Founded in 2016, Revamp is the premier engineering design firm focused on large-scale renewable energy projects. We are committed to doing our part in the energy transition and providing a welcoming workplace for talented people ready to make a real difference in fighting climate change. In the last 5 years, Revamp engineers have designed more than 14% of all installed utility-scale solar generation capacity in the US (11 out of 82 GW).

We are made up of a diverse group of mostly remote, US-based employees spanning from the East Coast all the way to The Aloha State of Hawaii! We are artists, immigrants, singers, dancers, pastry chefs, outdoor enthusiasts, animal lovers, and travelers who embrace innovation and collaboration. For more information, visit our website at www.revamp-eng.com.

Duties & Responsibilities:
Perform steady-state, dynamic stability, and short-circuit analyses using industry-standard software such as PSS/E, PowerWorld, and PSLF.
Develop and validate PSCAD models for renewable generation resources, including solar, wind, and energy storage systems.
Support and conduct NERC compliance studies to ensure adherence to applicable regulations and standards.
Demonstrate a strong understanding of FERC, NERC, and RTO/ISO processes and their interactions.
As a secondary responsibility, perform system studies including but not limited to protective device coordination and the following explorations: short circuit, arc flash, load flows, ampacity, grounding, harmonic, and power quality.
As a secondary responsibility, design collection systems, including cable routing and cable sizing.
As a secondary responsibility, create equipment specifications for and apply knowledge of renewable energy systems including PV solar modules, inverters, battery energy storage systems (BESS), transformers, cable management systems, and balance-of-system (BOS).
Write reports and make presentations describing studies performed, solutions developed, and value obtained.
Ensure compliance with company, industry, trade, and jurisdictional safety standards, practices, codes.
May lead multiple projects of varying complexity.
May evaluate, select, and apply standard procedures, and criteria.
May prepare project documentation.
Support client interaction for multiple projects.
May assign tasks to and direct less experienced team members to complete assignments.
May assist with proposals to provide professional services.
May provide mentoring for staff engineers.
Attend project meetings and present specific aspects of engineering assignments with high proficiency and confidence.
Receives guidance, when necessary, on unconventional or complex problems, direction on modified techniques, and new approaches on assignments with conflicting criteria.
Receives a review of completed work for application of sound professional judgment.
Perform essential duties including meeting deliverables and deadlines.
Perform additional duties as assigned or directed.

Experience, Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:
Bachelor's degree or greater in Electrical Engineering or similar.
EIT Certificate or PE Licensure is desirable.
Prior experience with the interconnection processes in major ISOs such as ERCOT, NYISO, MISO, and CAISO. Familiarity with interconnection processes in other ISOs/RTOs is a plus.
2+ years of experience in power systems analysis
Advanced knowledge of power systems analysis software tools such as PSCAD, PSS/E, PSLF or similar.
Knowledge of power distribution, transmission, solar PV systems or energy storage systems is desirable.
Experience with renewable energy projects and grid integration.
Experience applying Python or similar programming languages for process automation is desirable.
Experience working with different vendor provided dynamic models is preferred.
Ability to identify and solve complex problems.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to be both creative and analytical.
Detail-oriented and accurate.
Efficient time management - handle multiple projects simultaneously and with minimal supervision including prioritizing, organizing, and planning effectively to meet all deadlines.

Benefits for Full-Time Positions:
Competitive compensation with bonus.
Full benefits package including 99% employer-paid health, vision, life, and dental insurance.
Medical, dependent care, and commuter FSA.
Monthly health and wellness stipend.
Attractive vacation, sick, and holiday pay.
Paid parental leave.
401(k) savings plan with 100% match up to 6%, vested immediately.
Profit-sharing.
Paid volunteer time off and charitable donation matching.

Disclaimer

All offers of employment with Revamp Engineering Inc. are contingent on the completion of a background check. Revamp Engineering Inc. conducts these background checks in compliance with applicable federal and state laws. Applicants will be: 1) provided with appropriate written notice of the background check, 2) asked to authorize the background check before it is performed, and 3) provided the opportunity to obtain a free copy of any report obtained.

title: Pipeline Engineering Manager
full_description:
Join the Strategy Engineering Team! Strategy Engineering & Consulting, LLC is a leader in providing project management, engineering, drafting/design, reality capture, procurement, inspection, construction management, technical writing, and computerized maintenance management systems, for onshore and offshore oil and gas and renewables projects.

We offer a competitive benefits package.

The Pipeline Engineering Manager is responsible for managing the pipeline engineering activities for the company. In addition to managing the engineering aspects, the Pipeline Engineering Manager also heavily interfaces with the drafting & design departments, other engineering disciplines, and the Project Management team in the course of business. Primary scope is design of gathering and transportation pipelines and related facility projects for a wide variety of clients within the energy industry. The manager will also coordinate with 3rd party Land, ROW, Survey, Construction / Inspection teams, and possess a working knowledge of DOT & PHMSA regulations for design and compliance. The manager will also be responsible for direct client interface for projects assigned as well as managing projects from time to time, especially those which are pipeline only or pipeline focused.

Job Responsibilities and Duties:
Manage and supervise direct reports developing their technical competencies. Design and technical supervision of engineering activities associated with projects for the design of pipelines and pipeline facilities, including permit packages for FERC.
Flow assurance utilizing Pipesim multiphase flow simulation software and experience with UniSim and/or ProMax process modeling software to develop models as required for verification of pipeline hydraulics, pump station design requirements, and debottlenecking of systems for expansion.
Maintain in-house pipeline design standard documents for company and client use including, but not limited to, hydraulic analyses, alignment sheets and crossing details, Horizontal Directional Drill design, appurtenance detail drawings, material selection, and handling of purchased goods.
Coordinate with other engineering disciplines including design & drafting interface to minimize conflicts and errors ensuring a smooth project workflow.
Develop industry contacts to drive new business, meet with clients to define project objectives, prepare proposals and finalize project contracts, while interacting with clients, vendors, contractors, and fabricators to resolve project issues.
Assist with preparation of technical documentation required for RFP / RFQ packages and prepare technical evaluations of equipment / service packages.

Required Skills/Qualifications:
A Bachelor's degree in Civil or Mechanical Engineering from an accredited institution.
Minimum twelve (12) years' experience in the Distribution and Midstream Oil & Gas industry with a minimum of eight (8) years' experience in design of pipeline installation projects for transmission companies, e.g., meter and compressor station design.
Working knowledge of Pipesim and experience with UniSim and/or ProMax; other hydraulic simulation software experience is a plus for growth, but not required.
Working knowledge of current industry codes & specifications including API RPs, 49 CFR 192 / 195, and PHMSA's Mega Rule(s).
Excellent written and verbal English language communication skills.
Proficiency with MS Office Suite, Google Earth Pro, Bluebeam Revu, Navisworks, and GIS software applications.
Willingness to work hours in excess of 40 hours per week as required by department workload.
Must be a legal United States citizen or otherwise legally able to work in the U.S.A.
P.E. licensure is preferred but not required.

title: Sales Engineer - Power Systems
full_description:
The devices we make at SEL are embedded in the power grid. They prevent blackouts. They make outages safer and shorter in duration; they add cybersecurity, automation, and communication. They use cutting-edge technologies and operate at speeds that push other pieces of the grid to go faster. SEL products and technologies are critical for the safe, reliable operation of power systems around the world, so our products are built with the highest-quality components in SEL facilities by SEL employees.

At Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories, Inc. (SEL), our mission is to make electric power safer, more reliable, and more economical. Our company prides itself on embracing the values of quality, reliability, integrity, and excellent customer service. We were named as one of Fortune Magazine's 100 Best Workplaces for Millennials and among the top Best Workplaces for Baby Boomers. Working at SEL means having the opportunity to explore different career options - from customer service, sales, technical support, to management. We encourage professional development because when you are your best, that is when we are our best.

As a Sales Engineer, a typical day might include the following:
Manage and develop relationships with SEL customers.
Understand the true requirements and objectives of customers. Determine, communicate and deliver the optimal SEL solution that best meets their needs.
Building and maintain knowledge of all SEL products and teaching customers SEL technology and innovation.
Develop, maintain and deliver upon quarterly orders forecasts and sales goals.
Collect, analyze and report industry, competitor and customer trends to the greater SEL organization.
Work collaboratively to understand and drive the resolution of customer feedback and product issues.
Liaise between customers, contracts & risk, and accounts receivable to facilitate commercial relationships.
Utilize business tools to maintain customer relationship information, opportunity tracking and sales activities.

This job might be for you if possess the following:
A B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, a related engineering discipline or equivalent combination of education and/or work experience in technical sales
2 or more years of experience in an electrical engineering or technical sales environment
Demonstrated success working in a customer facing role
Ability to travel 25-30% of the time
Effective and engaging communication skills
Ability to skillfully manage price and commercial negotiations with the support and guidance of senior team members
Ability to learn new skills and assume new responsibilities
Ability to work cooperatively in a team environment

Preferred Qualifications:
Utility, industrial, or manufacturing industry experience
Experience with electrical relay panels or enclosures
Leadership experience
Experience using SEL products

Location:

This position is located in Charlotte, NC, a vibrant and bustling metropolis located in the heart of North Carolina. As one of the fastest-growing cities in the United States, it seamlessly blends its rich history with a modern and dynamic atmosphere. With an eclectic culinary scene, charming neighborhoods, and a warm southern hospitality, Charlotte exudes a unique charm that captivates residents and visitors alike.

Competitive pay. Superior benefits. Inspiring work.

People are at the core of our company and we hire employee-owners. We welcome you to learn more about how we support employees.
We're 100% employee owned. Retirement benefits include an employer funded stock ownership plan (ESOP) and personal 401K options.
We offer top tier medical, prescription, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance.
We recognize the importance of a healthy life balance and offer: 10 paid holidays, annual vacation accrual starting at 12 days, 9 paid sick days, and paid family and medical leave that covers 90% of your pay.
We foster growth and development of our employees through avenues such as STEM courses, apprenticeships, tuition assistance, and engineering development programs.
Ask our team about other benefits including wellness, fertility, adoption, and flexible spending benefits.

Pay Range Data

$80,000 - $120,000 per year. Our pay ranges are determined by job, responsibility, and location. We base our starting pay offer on location and job-related factors such as candidate experience, training, knowledge, and skills.

Communication with Applicants

We communicate with all applicants. If you do not receive a response about your application, please check your SPAM filter or reach out to us at careers@selinc.com.

SEL is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Vets/Disabled.

title: Sensor Software Specialist
full_description:
Specialist | Full-Time | Information Technology

Join our team as a Specialist in Future Sensing Sensors at Vestas Power Solutions. You'll play a crucial role in delivering software for complex sensor solutions, ensuring best-in-class quality, and creating value for both Vestas and our customers. This is the ideal environment for you if you want to apply your software engineering skills, collaborate with a highly diverse team and create innovation!

Power Solutions & Vestas Quality > Turbine Control Software > Advanced Sensing & Diagnostics

The Advanced Sensing and Diagnostics Sub Module is part of the Turbine Control Software Module within Vestas Power Solutions. We are responsible for delivering the software for the most complex sensor solutions, including Wind Sensing, Tower Accelerations and Blade Load Sensing. Next to providing this software, it is part of our DNA to validate and verify our solutions on real data to ensure best-in-class quality. Furthermore, our mission is to create smart sensor signals, which enable the turbine to run more efficiently and enable us to detect current and potential future defects to improve our service business and thus create value for Vestas and our customers.

Responsibilities
Drive best practices across the team together with the functional leads
Ensure Simulink Standards are improved and introduced using model based design
Enable the team to work efficiently with Data
Develop new algorithms for smart sensing and diagnostics solutions
Together with the team ensure on budget and on time quality project deliverables
Conduct root cause analysis to pinpoint potential turbine performance issues together with our stakeholders


Qualifications
A Masters Degree in Software Engineering, Control Engineering or any related subject
At least 7 years of experience in embedded software delivery with experience working with Simulink and Matlab.
Familiar with Bitbucket, Jira and other Atlassian tools, C++ coding skills would be highly advantageous
A physical or data analytical background, which enables you to understand turbine physics easily and process large sets of data efficiently
Previous experience with guiding a team toward technical deliverables


Competencies
A highly accountable and motivated individual who serves as a role model, enabling the team to perform at their best within an agile framework.
Upholds high standards of quality without compromise
Embraces change and proactively takes improvement ideas or problems and creates solutions
Good communication skills combined with external and internal stakeholder management
Ability to reach out proactively to stakeholders within and outside the company
Culturally open-minded, capable of building relationships across geographical and cultural boundaries


What We Offer

Within VSP we are one of the most cross-functional departments with a huge potential to create customer value, we are on an exciting journey of getting our processes, tools, and requirements to the highest standards. You can be part of this but be part of a team whose mission it is to improve how the turbines function.

Additional Information

We are considering candidates for both Porto, Portugal or Aarhus, Denmark.

Applications are handled on an ongoing basis and we're looking forward to receiving your application

BEWARE - RECRUITMENT FRAUD
It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, https://www.vestas.com/en/careers/our-recruitment-process

DEIB Statement
At Vestas, we recognize the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, "Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

About Vestas
Vestas is the energy industry's global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.
Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 173 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.
With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution - today, tomorrow, and far into the future.
Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.
To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

title: Student* with Master Thesis (optional) Modeling of Offshore Logistics Software
full_description:
Who we are ...
Our primary focuses at Fraunhofer IWES are on wind energy and hydrogen technologies. Our institute is home to more than 300 scientists and employees as well as over 100 students from over 30 countries pursuing careers in applied research and development at nine sites. We secure investments in technological developments through validation, shorten innovation cycles, accelerate certification procedures, and increase planning accuracy by means of innovative measurement methods.

This team needs your support ...
You will be part of the group »Offshore Logistics« at our sites in Bremerhaven and Bremen. At present, our team consists of seven research associates and several students. The aim of our group is to develop innovative methods for optimizing installation and operation concepts for offshore wind farms. Our activities currently focus on the development of software tools that can be used to map and analyze the installation and entire life cycle of an offshore wind farm in detailed time series simulations. Become an active member of the team; we are keen to hear your ideas! As an international oriented IWES-team, we highly appreciate an open exchange, whether this be in German or English. Respectful cooperation is also very important to us. You are wondering what you can bring to the team?

What you will do

These duties await you ...
You will be involved in the development of new scientific approaches for models simulating risks in offshore decommissioning projects. In order to know the current state of developments, your tasks will include reviewing literature. You will also implement developed models of your team into a software tool with a particular emphasis on evaluating data and conducting case scenarios to test the software. You will ensure that the software it is both accurate and reliable. To achieve this, you will document your methods, prepare comprehensive reports, and summarize your research findings. After an initial induction, it is also possible to write your master thesis in this field.

What you bring to the table

What is your background?
You are currently enrolled in a master's degree program studying Engineering, ideally with a focus on Wind Energy, or Industrial Engineering and have great programming skills in Python. Maybe, you have some experience in analyzing data and modeling simulations? Perfect! You should be able to communicate in English fluently, since you will work with an international team.

What you can expect

What we can offer you ...
We offer various opportunities to join us as a student. Whether it is an internship, where you gain a comprehensive insight into the areas of work, or the role of a student assistant, which is easy to combine with your studies. Are you looking for an exciting topic for your thesis and do you want to delve deeply into a topic scientifically? Together, we will find the right path for you! We know that studying can also be very demanding and requires a certain level of flexibility. That is no problem here, as - in agreement with your colleagues - you can decide flexibly what days and hours to work. Temporarily, you can even work remotely, depending on the job.

Eager to learn more?
If you would like to find out more information about the IWES, our research aspects, and your future colleagues, please visit our career website: https://s.fhg.de/5ei

We value and promote the diversity of our employees' skills and therefore welcome all applications - regardless of age, gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion, ideology, disability, sexual orientation, and identity. Severely disabled persons are given preference in the event of equal suitability.

The standard contract duration is 1 year, individual agreements are possible. The working time consists of up to 80 hours per month. Remuneration according to the general works agreement for employing assistant staff.

With its focus on developing key technologies that are vital for the future and enabling the commercial utilization of this work by business and industry, Fraunhofer plays a central role in the innovation process. As a pioneer and catalyst for groundbreaking developments and scientific excellence, Fraunhofer helps shape society now and in the future.

Interested? Apply online now. We look forward to getting to know you!

If you have any further questions, please contact:
People & Development
E-mail: personal@iwes.fraunhofer.de
Phone: +49 471 14 290-230

Only online applications via the portal can be considered.
Please note that we observe the provisions of the valid General Data Protection Regulation when processing applications.

Fraunhofer Institute for Wind Energy Systems

www.iwes.fraunhofer.de

title: Software Developer
full_description:
Job Summary

If you are a professional looking for an opportunity to work with the global Emerson Systems and Software organization, this is a stimulating opportunity for you! Our development organization has transformed into a Scaled Agile environment and is seeking a Software Developer professional. Set to be working in conjunction with a team of Software Developers within a Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe)-based organization aimed at delivering best-in-class process automation products built across web, cloud, PC, and embedded platforms integrated with internally developed devices. The ideal candidate has multiple years of exposure with IT/engineering and/or operating complex software systems supporting the maintenance and lifecycle of products and understands a range of customer use cases across industries. The successful candidate should be able to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment and communicate successfully with a wide range of people, experience levels, and technical backgrounds.

In this role, your responsibilities will be:
Delivering high-quality quality potentially releasable incremental value of the product regularly by being a member of a self-organizing and self-managing multi-functional team producing complete working features in short increments.
Involved in the requirement's analysis, architecture and design, implementation, testing, deployment, debugging, and maintaining existing code as well as new features accepted by the team during a sprint, including settling the right level of documentation and processes required for the project.
Creating and performing manual and automated unit, integration, and other functional & non-functional testing (e.g. security, performance, robustness, etc.) in alignment with customer requirements.
Refining the requirements of features with product owners and other stakeholders to reduce or eliminate technical ambiguities
Applying best practices during software development
Working with the collaborators to settle the level of definition needed for each feature and to ensure clear, achievable acceptance criteria
Continuously learning appropriate domain knowledge, technologies, skills, and tools required for process improvements spanning multiple product domains.


Who You Are:

You have a strong bottom-line orientation. You experiment to find new solutions. You follow through on commitments. You make sound decisions, even in the absence of complete information. You anticipate the impact of emerging technologies and make adjustments.

For this role, you will need:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
Minimum 4 years of experience in software product development or technology division
Working knowledge of at least one object-oriented programming language like C#, C++, or Java
Proven understanding of one or more technologies like ASP.NET, .NET Core, ReactJS, NodeJS, Angular, REST, TypeScript, Containerization, MongoDB, SQL databases and modeling
SDLC experience in delivering projects on time with high quality, covering requirements analysis, design, implementation, and testing
Strong in OOP and OOA/D including experience in using UML and software design patterns
Experience working with version control, build, deployment, test management tools, and CI/CD tools (like GIT, Azure DevOps, Visual Studio, etc.)


Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:
Experience in Agile software development methodologies and frameworks like Scrum and SAFe
Experience in Cybersecurity, Cloud-based development/deployment, DevOps
Experience in developing automated test cases, test-driven-development or using any kind of test automation framework
Participated in the development and delivery of a large project on time, with quality, and within requirements.
Knowledge in any Mobile, AI, Analytics, or Data Science application development
Knowledge of Process Control Systems


Our Offer to You

By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do.

Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets. We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees.

We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion.

We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential. We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company.

We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office.

Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities.

Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.

This philosophy is fundamental to living our company's values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson.

If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact idisability.administrator@emerson.com.

ABOUT US

WHY EMERSON

Our Commitment to Our People

At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration.

We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world's most complex problems - for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You'll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor.

At Emerson, you'll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let's go. Let's think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let's go, together.

ABOUT EMERSON

Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability.

With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety.

We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. title: Software Tester
full_description:
Job Summary:

Our development organization has transformed into a Scaled Agile environment and is seeking a Software Tester. In this role, you will be working in an Agile team sought at delivering outstanding process automation products built across web, cloud, PC, and embedded platforms coordinated with internally developed devices. The ideal candidate has experience and deep understanding of customer scenarios in the process control and automation industry. The successful candidate should be able to advocate for quality and customers, work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment and communicate effectively with a wide range of people, experience levels, and technical backgrounds.

In this role, your responsibilities will be:
Work as Software Tester within a cross-functional team in an agile environment, having deep understanding of customer scenarios in the process control and automation industry as well as broad skills in contributing to other end-to-end activities of the software development lifecycle (e.g. analyzing requirements, crafting test scenarios, executing tests, reporting bugs and recommending product improvements/enhancements)
Ensure the quality of deliverables for desktop, web, or mobile solutions by defining test plans, performing manual and automated testing, and developing automation frameworks that covers functional, integration, system, performance, and regression aspects in alignment with customer requirements.
Support the design, development, and deployment of software components, covering functional, and non-functional aspects like security, performance, robustness, etc.
Continuously learn appropriate proven experience, technologies, skills and tools needed for process improvements spanning multiple product domains
Collaborate effectively with marketing, product owners, architects, and UX designers from requirements analysis, design, implementation, reviews, up to delivering project requirements in a multi-national, multi-cultural organization.


Who You Are:

You set aggressive goals and has high standards. You look beyond the obvious and doesn't stop at the first answers. You gain the confidence and trust of others easily.

For this Role You Will Need:
Graduate of a BS Engineering course (ChE, EE, ECE, ME, Comp Sci, Comp Eng, ICE or equivalent degree) or an MS Engineering graduate
With at least 2 years of relevant process control, instrumentation, and automation proven experience
Knowledge or experience in configuring or operating DCS, PLC or SCADA.
Familiarity with operations in any of the following process industries: hydrocarbon processing, oil and gas, pulp and paper, specialty chemicals, pharmaceutical, food and beverage or power generation.
Experienced in planning and leading instrumentation or process control projects or teams.
Able to communicate effectively in local and international settings

Experience in customer interactions through project requirements gathering, configuration and commissioning, onsite troubleshooting, or FAT/SAT activities.

title: Tech Prof-Software Development
full_description:

Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world's largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry.

title: Global Procurement Lead Specialist Software
full_description:
Become an integral part of Vestas, the global leader in the wind industry, as our new software procurement specialist!

If you are eager to make your mark in a high-paced and inspiringly multicultural organization, we would love to have you on our team.

Manufacturing & Global Procurement > Global Procurement > Global Indirect Procurement

Vestas Global Procurement is an award-winning best in class Procurement function. We are overall responsible for all Procurement activities within Vestas Wind System A/S, including Strategy development and implementation, Value creation initiatives, negotiations, Supplier Relationship Management and Supplier Account Management. Our Procurement organization consist of app. 600 dedicated colleagues across the globe, with app. 120 in the headquarter in Aarhus, Denmark.

You will be an important part of the Software Category, which is responsible for Vestas's global procurement of Software and platforms to support the digitalization journey for Vestas, and with a yearly spend around 100 mio. euro. You will report to the Senior Manager for Global IT Procurement, playing a key role in setting the direction for the area and ensuring that Vestas has the best agreements and solutions for powering the solutions to shape a greener future.

Responsibilities
Lead and develop partnerships with strategic software suppliers like Microsoft
Collaborate on global Software strategy to maximize value from agreements
Foster world-class supplier collaboration and effective category structures
Represent the Global IT Procurement team and act as an ambassador
Lead global software negotiations, set direction, and plan execution
Ensure Vestas maximizes value and savings from supplier collaborations
Continue to build an environment of enthusiasm, speed, solid results, smile and fun!


Qualifications
Background in IT procurement with experience negotiating software contracts and understand the complexities of such contracts with respect to commercial and legal risks
You have experience with category management, including guiding cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and large complex suppliers
Good theoretical background within Procurement, Finance or Supply chain
Great negotiator who lives for delivering the expected savings, solutions and does not take no for an answer


Competencies
Efficient communication, collaboration and analytical skills
Driven to find optimal solutions on behalf of all of us at VestasEffective at stakeholder management and relationship building
Structured and adept at planning


What we offer

We offer you an exciting job with great opportunities for both professional and personal development and impact. You will hold a high degree of freedom, and an opportunity to set your own footprint within an essential area in Vestas. You will be part of an international team, with a lot of passion, a "can-do" attitude and aspiration to make a difference.

Additional information
Location: Aarhus N, Denmark. The position requires 10-20 days of annual travel activity.
Application Deadline: 18 December 2024 - We reserve the right to remove this posting when the right candidate is identified

Start Date: ASAP or before/after mutual agreement

For additional Questions: Please reach out to Lead Specialist, Allan Vastrup at +4528351980

At Vestas, we recognize the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, "Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

About Vestas
Vestas is the energy industry's global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.
Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 173 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.
With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution - today, tomorrow, and far into the future.
Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.
To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

title: Sr. Product Manager - Software, Controls and Energy Storage CCI
full_description:
Power the Future with us!

SolarEdge (NASDAQ: SEDG), is a global leader in high-performance smart energy technology, with over 5000 employees, offices in 34 countries, and millions of products installed in over 133 countries.

Our diverse product offering comprises intelligent solar inverters, battery storage, backup systems, EV charging, and complete home energy management ecosystems.

By leveraging world-class engineering capabilities and with a relentless focus on innovation, we strive to create a world where clean, green energy from the sun is the primary source of power for our homes, businesses, and just about everywhere we thrive.

The Sr. Product Manager is responsible for defining regional requirements for SolarEdge products for the Community, Commercial and Industrial segments, promoting those requirements to product management and R&D, and orchestrating the resultant product launch within the region. They are also responsible for identifying applications and markets for SolarEdge products in the region and working with SolarEdge customers to identify those applications and promote SolarEdge's products.

Focus areas for this position will be Energy Storage applications, integration of Solar, Energy Storage, Site Loads and EV Charging, with emphasis in Software for monitoring, controls and communication of plant assets.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Definition of new product and feature requirements in the North America CCI Segment for Monitoring and Controls of Solar, Storage, building loads by working with the regional commercial team, customers and Headquarters.
Product launch - plan the launch of new products and releases and manage the cross-functional implementation of the plan
Track and monitor competitive activity in the industry. Develop product positioning and messaging that differentiates SolarEdge products in the market
Sales enablement - communicate the value proposition of the products to the sales team and develop the sales tools that support the selling process of your products. develop the strategy and manage the marketing programs that drive demand.
Educate and develop account management staff. Coach and motivate account group leaders to effectively develop and motivate their direct reports. Identify and recommend internal and external training opportunities.

BS in Engineering or equivalent required.
5-10 years experience in the solar or storage industry working in Product Management or Technical Marketing roles.
Experience working with software and controls for renewable energy projects.
Experience in product management or applications support for energy storage products and projects.
Electric power industry domain experience with demonstrated understanding of renewable energy operations
Excellent industry knowledge of competition, market trends in the renewable energy industry with focus on integration of PV, energy storage, EV charging and building loads.
Knowledge of NEC and regulatory codes for PV and Storage installations.
Strong communication skills including listening and handling objections and complex discussions with Product Management Team.
Strong presentation skills.
Strong time and project management skills to proactively build trust and confidence as a remote employee.
Product launch and business development experience required.
Experience in cyber-security is a plus.

FAIR PAY & A JUST WORKPLACE

SolarEdge proudly seeks to build a richly diverse workforce by hiring people with a diversity of thoughts, identities, perspectives, and experiences that help advance the difference we make for consumers, and by ensuring our people experience equity and inclusion in their work lives. We encourage members of traditionally underrepresented communities to apply, including women, LGBTQIA people, people of color, and people with disabilities.

title: Director & GM, Renewables Energy & Software
full_description:
Job Description

The Director & GM leads the vision, strategy, and execution for growth and profitability for the renewable energy and software business by providing direction to a high performing global leadership team focusing on Independent Engineering, Technical Advisory, and Software. The Director is expected to achieve a high rate of revenue growth (20-40% YoY) and strong profitability, while taking care to protect UL's brand reputation as a leading quality provider of renewable energy services.

Responsibilities

Establish and communicate the overall business strategy for the business, consistent with Renewables segment mission, goals, and strategy.
Responsible for global profit & loss for the Renewables segment.
Establish revenue goals, staffing requirements, and budgets, in conjunction with Renewables Segment and Service Area leads.
Manage costs to budget and identify and exploit potential cost savings and efficiency improvements.
Ensure revenue goals are met, in conjunction with commercial and operational leaders.
Analyze and track financial performance against revenue and profit targets. Identify and recommend remedial actions where necessary. Select subcontractors as needed.
Lead business development, including identifying and developing new customers, defining and championing new services, and identifying opportunities for acquisition. Provide market insights and intelligence.
Work with executive leadership and other cross-functional leaders on the strategy development and execution matters related to the success of the business segment.
Coordinate across other business segments, functions and regions to ensure profitable growth.
Lead, empower, and enable Service Area teams to succeed in meeting established revenue and profit goals. Oversee staff assigned to the business including business development, sales, and other functional staff (F&A, IT, HR, etc.) to support Service Areas and achieve revenue goals and efficient and effective operations.
Prepare and execute staffing plans and conduct regular employee evaluations. Fill open positions. Support Service Area leads in managing technical staff to a high level of performance.
Ensure good communication and consistency with company policies and best practices in all aspects of the operation. Provide leadership and guidance to all employees to ensure a high level of customer and employee satisfaction and profitable business performance.
Build a strong and internationally capable management team, including developing bench strength for long term succession planning focusing on the internal development of high potential employees wherever possible.
Represent company at tradeshows, technical conferences and workshops, and business development meetings, as needed.
Attend leadership meetings, present business plans, strategy, results and reports.
Requires frequent travel to customers, regional offices and business development opportunities (30% - 40% travel).
Assist with other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

BS or BA degree in business, management, engineering, or a technical field required; an advanced degree is preferred.
10+ years of senior leadership experience in consulting, preferably in the Renewables industry
Proven strong commercial skills, engaging with customers and industry
Strong relationships with banks and investors
Innovative and entrepreneurial; Ability to develop, implement and support strategies.
Experience leading a P&L
Significant experience in North America renewable industry preferred
Superior attention to detail and ability to multi-task and prioritize effectively.
Excellent organizational skills.
Exceptional written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills with internal and external parties.
Visionary, strategic thinker who leads the change in the market.
Able to partner and leader partnerships across global, matrixed and cross-functional divisions/teams.
Able to evaluate risk effectively and move forward quickly.
Proven record of building strong people and teams.

Total Rewards:

The salary range for this position is USD $215,000 - USD $273,000 and is based upon years of experience that is commensurate with the level of the position.

All employees at UL Solutions are eligible for annual bonus compensation. The target for this position is 30% of the base salary offered. Additionally, director level employees are eligible for annual long-term incentive. The target for this position is 30% of the base salary offered. Employees are eligible for health benefits such as medical, dental and vision; wellness benefits such as mental & financial health; and retirement savings (401K) commensurate with the standard rewards offered in each individual location or country, for the relevant position level.

We also provide employees with paid time off including vacation (20 days), holidays including floating holidays (12 days) and sick time off (72 hours).

Internal applicants with questions related to the Total Rewards for this position should submit a ticket via askHR for more insights.

#LI-WM1 #LI-REMOTE

About Us

A global leader in applied safety science, UL Solutions (NYSE: ULS) transforms safety, security and sustainability challenges into opportunities for customers in more than 110 countries. UL Solutions delivers testing, inspection and certification services, together with software products and advisory offerings, that support our customers' product innovation and business growth. The UL Mark serves as a recognized symbol of trust in our customers' products and reflects an unwavering commitment to advancing our safety mission. We help our customers innovate, launch new products and services, navigate global markets and complex supply chains, and grow sustainably and responsibly into the future. Our science is your advantage.

About the Team

We solve our customers' problems. Within Software & Advisory (S&A) services, UL Solutions' Enterprise Sustainability business focuses on solving some of the most pressing world challenges - renewables, energy transition, sustainability, health & wellbeing, return to work and people safety. We do this through Renewable Energy Advisory and Digital Services, Environmental, Health and Safety Software & Learning programs, best in class Sustainability and ESG reporting software with UL 360, advisory services, subject matter experts and Healthy Buildings testing and verification.

title: Internship: Creation of a software for the development of Commissioning model sheets in the EasyPlant monitoring tool - F/M
full_description:

Technip Energies - Together, pushing the boundaries to shape a sustainable future

Technip Energies is a leading engineering and technology company serving the energy transition, with leading positions in Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG), hydrogen and ethylene and with a strong presence in the growing markets of blue and green hydrogen, sustainable chemistry, floating offshore wind turbines and CO2 capture and storage. title: Software Developer - SMS Guardian
full_description:

You will be supporting Emerson's global internal CRM, Service Management System and our customer-facing portal, Guardian. These two systems work together to power a billion-dollar business. You will be working with a diverse group of people committed to supporting our customers and building a better future.

title: Associate Sales Engineer - Power Systems
full_description:
The devices we make at SEL are embedded in the power grid. They prevent blackouts. They make outages safer and shorter in duration; they add cybersecurity, automation, and communication. They use cutting-edge technologies and operate at speeds that push other pieces of the grid to go faster. SEL products and technologies are critical for the safe, reliable operation of power systems around the world, so our products are built with the highest-quality components in SEL facilities by SEL employees. As a Sales Engineer in Sales and Customer Service, you'll work to develop strong partnerships with our customers while offering unmatched value in our products and services.

As a Sales Engineer, a typical day might include the following:
Manage and develop relationships with SEL customers.
Understand the true requirements and objectives of customers. Determine, communicate and deliver the optimal SEL solution that best meets their needs.
Building and maintain knowledge of all SEL products and teaching customers SEL technology and innovation.
Develop, maintain and deliver upon quarterly orders forecasts and sales goals.
Collect, analyze and report industry, competitor and customer trends to the greater SEL organization.
Work collaboratively to understand and drive the resolution of customer feedbacks and product issues.
Liaise between customers, contracts & risk, and accounts receivable to facilitate commercial relationships.
Utilize business tools to maintain customer relationship information, opportunity tracking and sales activities.

This job might be for you if possess the following:
B.S. in Electrical Engineering or related engineering discipline or equivalent combination of education and/or work experience in technical sales
3 or more years of experience in an electrical engineering or technical sales environment
Demonstrated success working in a customer facing role
Ability to travel 75-80% of the time
Effective and engaging communication skills
Ability to learn new skills and assume new responsibilities
Ability to work cooperatively in a team environment
Fluent in local language and business practices

Preferred Qualifications
Master's degree in Business Administration, Management, or related discipline
Experience using SEL products
Utility and Industrial industry experience
Leadership experience

Location

This position is located in King of Prussia, PA. Located just twenty miles from Philadelphia, its close proximity allows residents to enjoy all that the big city has to offer. Enjoy easy access to trails along the river, or attend sporting events nearby. The diverse options make King of Prussia the perfect place to call home.

Competitive pay. Superior benefits. Inspiring work.

People are at the core of our company and we hire employee-owners. We welcome you to learn more about how we support employees.
We're 100% employee owned. Retirement benefits include an employer funded stock ownership plan (ESOP) and personal 401K options.
We offer top tier medical, prescription, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance.
We recognize the importance of a healthy life balance and offer: 10 paid holidays, annual vacation accrual starting at 12 days, 9 paid sick days, and paid family and medical leave that covers 90% of your pay.
We foster growth and development of our employees through avenues such as STEM courses, apprenticeships, tuition assistance, and engineering development programs.
Ask our team about other benefits including wellness, fertility, adoption, and flexible spending benefits.

Pay Range Data

New hires generally start with a base salary between $90,000 - $100,000 per year, with additional commission available. We base our starting pay offer on location and job-related factors such as candidate experience, training, knowledge, and skills.

Communication with Applicants

We communicate with all applicants. If you do not receive a response about your application, please check your SPAM filter or reach out to us at careers@selinc.com.

SEL is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Vets/Disabled.

title: Project Engineering Manager - Nuclear Power
full_description:
At United we are a team of engineers, builders, planners and thinkers that design and build today's infrastructure, for tomorrow. We come to work every day committed to drive growth and deliver projects that matter for our clients, ourselves, and our communities. Through our work in the nuclear, conventional generation, renewable and power delivery markets, we create resilient infrastructure to last generations.

Position Description

United E&C has an immediate need for a Project Engineering Manager to support Nuclear Generating Stations in the Detroit/Chicago/Toledo area. The successful candidate will be working as a liaison with the clients and with a team of Engineers and Designers on the support of plant modification packages Responsibilities will include:
Serve as primary representative for UECI as a field liaison between the client and engineering group.
Provide engineering management and guidance to subordinate staff, enforces company and project policies and
serves as a liaison between UECI and client interface.
Plans and manages work activities to ensure successful project execution while maintaining safety, quality, schedule, and budget adherence.
Often working under the supervision of a Project Director or above, demonstrates and provides project leadership in their area of responsibility.
Supervises and delegates tasks among staff.
Monitors day-today activities and consistently demonstrates the ability to proactively identify potential project
problems or opportunities, analyze the issues using all appropriate resources, develop alternatives, and arrive at the most optimum approach to mitigate problems or exploit opportunities.
Demonstrates knowledge of resources and capabilities of other groups for appropriate incorporation into project organization.
Clearly understands the scope of work and contract requirements or those requirements that pertain to his/her area of responsibility.
Supports or conducts formal status reporting and presentations to client and/or management.

Minimum Experience:
B.S. Engineering Degree from an accredited university in an Engineering Discipline
Professional Engineering (PE) License in any State with ability to be licensed in other States by Comity
Experience working in a nuclear plant
Must be able to obtain and maintain unescorted access at a nuclear power plant.
Experience working with others in a Project Team environment

Must have strong skills in the following areas:
Written and oral communications skills
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to prioritize and organize work in a multi-tasked environment

Preferred Requirements:
M.S. in an Engineering discipline, with Power Focus
Field experience / Walk-downs on power projects
Electrical and/or Instrumentation & Controls Engineering background
Experience preparing Engineering Design Modification Packages for Nuclear Power plants including familiarity with
Nuclear Standard Design Process (IP-ENG-01)

Due to the nature of work that United performs, candidates must be a US Citizen or Permanent Resident of the United States. Sponsorship is not available.

United E&C is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age, or any other federally protected class. United believes in each person's potential, and we will help you reach yours

title: Automation Engineer - Power Systems
full_description:
The devices we make at SEL are embedded in the power grid. They prevent blackouts. They make outages safer and shorter in duration; they add cybersecurity, automation, and communication. They use cutting-edge technologies and operate at speeds that push other pieces of the grid to go faster. As an Automation Engineer in Engineering Services, you'll provide solutions and services that help our customers protect and control critical electrical infrastructure and power systems worldwide.

As an Automation Engineer, a typical day might include the following:
Develop and maintain a proficient level of expertise in the detail design practices of SEL protection and automation systems.
Develop and maintain a proficient level of knowledge of SEL equipment and solutions to electric power system protection and automation applications.
RTAC/PLC programming and checkouts
Programming and applying SCADA application packages(Wonderware, Copadata Zenon, Citect, RTAC HMI, etc.)
Quality assurance and quality control checks
Commissioning (25%+ of the time)
Leading and supporting automation specific projects
Applying your understanding of relay and PLC AC/DC schematic and power system one lines
Designing LAN for utility/industrial applications
Communication architecture definition

This job might be for you if:
You have a B.S. degree in electrical engineering or relevant discipline
You have a good understanding of electrical power systems or industrial automation system practices
You have a basic knowledge of system protection, integration, and automation application
You are autonomous and self sufficient
You communicate openly and willingly
You are flexible and open to broadness
You have or are willing to dive into SEL products
You are willing to travel 25% of the time
You have strong writing, documentation, and speaking skills

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with electric power transmission, distribution, and/or generation systems
Working knowledge of electric power systems and protective relay applications
Experience with SCADA and PLC applications

Location

Houston, TX-This position is located in Houston, TX. Ranked America's fourth largest city, whatever your interest you will find it here. Enjoy sports teams, world class dining, and first rate entertainment. Enjoy signature Houston attractions like Space Center Houston and The Grand Opera. Escape the city with easy beach access just one hour away. Houston offers exceptional schools and universities, making it a great place to live and work.

This is your chance to build your career with a global leader and innovator in the power protection industry. Join Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories, a company of innovators, inventors & problem solvers to continue building the most innovate and safety-critical products so that future generations have the means to pursue an increasingly higher quality of life. Apply today!

Competitive pay. Superior benefits. Inspiring work.

People are at the core of our company and we hire employee-owners. We welcome you to learn more about how we support employees.
We're 100% employee owned. Retirement benefits include an employer funded stock ownership plan (ESOP) and personal 401K options.
We offer top tier medical, prescription, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance.
We recognize the importance of a healthy life balance and offer: 10 paid holidays, annual vacation accrual starting at 12 days, 9 paid sick days, and paid family and medical leave that covers 90% of your pay.
We foster growth and development of our employees through avenues such as STEM courses, apprenticeships, tuition assistance, and engineering development programs.
Ask our team about other benefits including wellness, fertility, adoption, and flexible spending benefits.

Pay Range Data

We anticipate filling this position as a Project Engineer - Automation:

Project Engineer II - Automation: $87,000.00 - $136,000.00.

Project Engineer III - Automation: $100,000.00 - $157,000.00

We are open to reviewing additional candidates with more or less experience and the salary range may differ if filled at a different level. Our salary ranges are determined by job, responsibility, and location. We base our starting pay offer and title on location and job-related factors such as candidate experience, training, knowledge, and skills.

Communication with Applicants

We communicate with all applicants. If you do not receive a response about your application, please check your SPAM filter or reach out to us at careers@selinc.com.

title: Lead Electrical Engineer - Renewable Energy Focus!
full_description:
LOCATION: Madison, WI; Denver, CO; Cincinnati, OH; Michigan; or St. Paul, MN

Excellence Through People! Take your engineering career to the next level by working with energetic, talented, and forward-thinking colleagues and clients who invest in the collective good, take a balanced approach to sustainable solutions, are flexible to the realities of complex changes, and provide genuine effort to do the right by others.

Who We Are:

Power System Engineering (PSE) is an electrical energy expert that provides relationship-driven engineering and consulting services for forward-thinking partners who pursue long-term energy solutions. Check out our website at: www.powersystem.org

Our Point of View:
People We foster strong relationships with our clients, colleagues, and community through integrity and our spirit of teamwork to further our collective well-being, safety, and success.
Problem-Solving We thrive on the unique challenges that stretch our skills and expertise, where we can turn complex challenges into opportunities for collaborative achievements.
Progress We create safe spaces for experimentation, treating each relationship and project as an opportunity to positively shape the culture and collective advancement.

What We Are Looking For:

The PSE Energy Resources team designs fun, challenging, rewarding, and high-profile renewable energy projects. We pride ourselves in striving to be an industry leader for the benefit of our clients and colleagues. We are looking for a well-rounded individual to lead the delivery of multidisciplinary Solar Photovoltaic (PV) and Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) projects through their feasibility, pre-construction, and construction phases with a specific focus on the electrical design aspects of projects. We seek a creative, intelligent, entrepreneurial, driven individual with expertise in the renewable energy industry. This unique opportunity requires an individual who enjoys engineering, business development, and project management roles. A "seller-doer" type who has high-quality technical and interpersonal skills. This is an exciting chance to lead a growing team and join a culture that promotes continual employee growth and development.

What You Will Be Doing:
Design and engineer utility-scale PV solar systems, energy storage, and microgrid projects between 5MW and 100MW+ in size. Projects include both standalone storage and storage plus solar.
Provide technical expertise and support in assisting utilities in planning for integrating renewable energy resources.
Maintain a vast knowledge of existing and emerging technologies in planning the future grid.
Develop engineering construction documents.
Develop detailed equipment specifications.
Contribute to developing internal solar engineering standards, toolsets, and work processes continually.
Coordinating project design assignments and design teams locally and with other office locations
Travel to project sites occasionally to gather site-specific data, as required.
Contributing to or writing technical papers and reports
Conduct system studies such as arc flash, load flow, short circuit, overcurrent coordination, ampacity, and grounding studies.
Coordinate communication and provide status updates to stakeholders as required.
Assure quality in design work by developing and following internal QA/QC methods.
Provide mentorship and training to new and junior engineering personnel.

What You Will Need:

Education and Experience
Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering with Power Systems Focus
5+ years' experience designing utility-scale solar PV systems and/or energy storage systems
PE (Professional Engineer) Licensure or the ability to get one within a reasonable time
Eligible to work in the United States without visa sponsorship.

Knowledge and Skills
Experience with AutoCAD, PVsyst, SKM, ETAP, SEL Relays.
Experience with industry-standard design codes such as NEC, International Building Codes, International Fire Codes, and other standards relevant to the industry.
Excellent written and verbal communication
Strong project management skills and ability to prioritize work and resources
Extremely organized and meticulous with details
Ability to work and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
NABCEP certification or willingness to get one

~Please note that the salary information displayed alongside this job posting may not accurately reflect the compensation package offered by our organization. We understand that some job boards may generate salary estimates or ranges based on available data, which may not accurately represent the compensation package we offer. We strive to provide competitive salaries based on industry standards, qualifications, and experience. For accurate and up-to-date information regarding compensation, benefits, and other employment details, please refer to the details provided directly by Power System Engineering during the application process or contact our HR department.

People. Power. Future

Power System Engineering is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Institution and does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender identity, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, religion, color, ancestry, or national origin or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Our management team is dedicated to this policy with respect to recruitment, hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, training, compensation, benefits, employee activities, and general treatment during employment.

title: Energy Engineer III
full_description:
ABOUT US

Partner Energy is an industry leader known for its expertise in the areas of green financing, regulatory compliance, and energy rebate/incentive programs. We were recently named one of the fastest growing private companies in the LA area by the Los Angeles Business Journal. Partner Energy is an innovative and entrepreneurial company that consistently receives high marks from its employees as a 'great place to work'.

Learn more about Partner Energy at www.ptrenergy.com

SUMMARY

Partner Engineering and Science Inc is seeking an experienced Energy Engineer to serve as a senior technical resource for our energy and sustainability consulting team. The successful candidate will manage and mentor associates and oversee projects involving the analysis, verification, design, and implementation of energy efficiency solutions; building commissioning and retro-commissioning; green building certifications; and/or, ESG&R consulting.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Conduct level I, II, III energy audits per ASHRAE standards for multiple asset types including apartment, office, industrial, hospital, and retail;
Perform whole-building energy modeling of multiple asset types;
Perform commissioning and retro-commissioning for multiple asset types;
Develop best practices for energy audits reports, energy modeling, and project implementation;
Conduct feasibility analyses of renewable energy generation projects for real estate applications;
Manage a team of associates, energy engineers, and subcontractors; and,
Assist in the hiring and training of project managers and project engineers.

QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelors Degree in Engineering and at least 7+ years experience in the energy efficiency or, a Master's Degree in Engineering and 5+ years of related experience
Professional Engineer designation (preferred)
Excellent verbal and written communication
Excellent analytical and management skills
Ability to work both independently and in a team environment
Ability to travel approximately 25% of time

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES
Experience conducting energy analyses of building systems, including HVAC systems, chillers, boilers, plumbing, renewable energy, and variable speed drive applications;
Thorough understanding of HVAC systems and their impact on energy efficiency recommendations
Knowledge of building automation systems, building envelope, and lighting systems;
Experience with designing, sizing, cost estimating, and implementation of energy efficiency projects;
Experience in commissioning and retro-commissioning of energy efficiency projects;
Experience using energy modeling programs such as eQuest, Energy Pro, Trace and/or Energy Plus;
Understanding of building maintenance and operation issues; and,
Ability to identify and apply for federal, state, and utility energy rebate and incentive programs.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Ability to climb ladders and stairs
Ability to work outdoors and unconditioned mechanical rooms
Visual acuity adequate to perform job duties, including reading information from printed sources and computer screen
Ability to travel approximately 20% of the time both in and out of state
Position requires frequent bending, reaching, standing, walking, sitting, pushing, and pulling exerted regularly throughout the work shift.

COMPENSATION

This is what we reasonably expect to pay for the role $100,000 -$130,000 annually.

The pay scale for this role considers a wide range of factors when making compensation decisions including, but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note, the disclosed pay scale estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic location where the position may be filled.

You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary incentive bonus program which is dependent on various factors, including, but not limited to individual and organizational performance.

Benefits:

Competitive benefits package including health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, vacation and sick time, and a 401(k) plan with a company match.

We will consider qualified applicants who have criminal histories in a manner consistent with the law.

Equal Employment Opportunity

It is Partner Engineering and Science, Inc's (The Company) policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. The Company does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, legally protected medical condition or information including genetic information, family care status, military caregiver status, veteran status, marital status, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal laws.
