title: Senior Project Engineer
full_description:
Project Engineer ( Production / Food / Automotive )  Woking Permanent
This is an exciting role which plays an instrumental part in the delivery of Engineering projects from Conception to Benefits realisation (Typically, £100 t £3M). This includes feasibility studies, cost estimates, proposals for both internal projects and third party sales across all business areas in the UK & Ireland. You will achieve this by supporting the Senior project managers and a multi  discipline engineering team
 You will be responsible for the delivery of engineering projects safely, on time and on budget to meet the needs of the business.
 Our mission is to grow together to make diversity our strength, build an inclusive and fair organisation where everyone feels valued, respected and included regardless of their background and identity.
We are committed to eliminating barriers that prevent employee success, support connections and collaboration and educate ourselves to build a culture of respect, support and understanding.  We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and encourage underrepresented groups to apply.
  Key responsibilities i
Develop project plans that encourage input and collaboration from all team members, ensuring diverse viewpoints and innovative ideas are incorporated.
To be commercially aware in ensuring that project design/costs developed are competitive & fit for purpose to support the business to deliver the required returns/win new 3rd party sales while balancing SHEQ requirements.
Responsible for identifying and reporting project risks and challenges with a broad perspective, encouraging team input for creative solutions. This includes variation management to increase sales and limiting/controlling supplier/contractor variations. 
To plan and co-ordinate engineering resource (internal & external) to execute projects.
To develop Project Proposals to achieve financial approval for project budgets.
Ensure that contractors demonstrate ownership and understanding of SHEQ strategy and objectives and that the teams comply with statutory requirements, company policies and procedures.
Build effective relationships with key customers and suppliers to ensure that the department is customer (internal & externally) focussed and responsive.
Ensure good engagement & communication with the customer (internal or external) throughout the project lifecycle. Seek and act on customer feedback. 
Manage site construction activities such as contractor control, permit to work, working at height, plant installations, mechanical and electrical installations, testing and commissioning of the inclusive of pressure testing, acceptance, documentation in the form of as built data, health and safety file incorporating operating and maintenance manuals. 
   Person specification (knowledge, skills, and experience) i
 Please note- we don't expect candidates to meet every single aspect of the specification. If your knowledge, skills and experience looks a little different from what we've identified and you think you can bring value to the role, we'd love to learn more about you!
 Knowledge: 
Knowledge of engineering practices/ contracting/ Project Management/ Industry standards 
Project management principles life cycle
Financial awareness and reporting metrics
Basic risk management 
Health and Safety Legislation including: o   Pressure Systems Safety Regulations (PSSR)  o          Construction Design & Management Regulations (CDM)
Forms of contract awareness.            
  Essential Qualification and Experience:
Degree/HNC/HND or equivalent engineering qualification in process/mechanical/electrical discipline or equivalent 
3  years practical industrial experience 
Strong understanding of engineering principles and a commitment to inclusive project management methodologies (e.g., APM, Agile). 
           -      
Knowledge in project engineering in either contracting or operating company environments, proposals, tendering, sub-contract activity, financial/cost management. 
Proven track record of project engineering on time, cost and to appropriate SHEQ standards
 Desirable Qualification and Experience:
IOSH/NEBOSH Certificate desirable
Project Management qualification e.g. APM, Prince2
Proficiency in project scheduling software (e.g., Microsoft Project, Primavera)
Professional membership to IChemE, IMechE, APM, IET or equivalent and working towards Chartership or equivalent would be a plus.
CVs to ana@kintecglobal.com

title: Structural Civil Engineer
full_description: Job Profile Job Title: STRUCTURAL / CIVIL ENGINEER Line Department: Engineering Organizational Unit: Engineering Reporting to: Lead Structural / Civil Engineer, Manager - Engineering Location: Qcon Ras Laffan H.O., Assigned Site Locations (QMFY) Direct Reports: Draftsmen Overview: To execute Detailed Engineering works with respect to Structural and Civil Engineering. To provide specific technical support service to ensure company's business objectives and clients' requirements are met with. Primary Purpose of the Job and Anticipated Deliverables Execute Detailed Engineering services related to Structural and Civil disciplines; assign to and supervise works of the team of Structural and Civil Draftsmen; monitor performance of Engineering Consultants; ensure quality of engineering documents; support Project Engineering Team; support Proposal Team with technical evaluations. As required, generate Technical Queries and Engineering Deviation Requests to support the assigned scope. Capabilities It is preferable that the candidates have the following capabilities: - Experience in the execution of Feasibility Studies, FEED and EPIC projects; performing pre-award FEED endorsement. - Experience in the execution of Oil and Gas, Petrochemical and Refinery, and Civil Infrastructure Projects. - Experience in both Offshore and Onshore fields. - Familiarity in the preparation of Structural and Civil Engineering procedures. - Good knowledge of HSE, Quality, and International Codes & Standards, including Shell DEPs, for implementation in Structural / Civil design. - High degree of proficiency in the use of Structural Analysis and Design Software: STAAD.Pro; Offshore Structural Analysis and Design Software: SACS; and MS Office packages - Excel, Word, Power Point.. - Experience in the preparation of Detailed Engineering deliverables related to Offshore Structures, including: G.A. and Details of Offshore JOB SPECIFICATION 2 Sr. Instrumentation / Telecommunication Engineer - Job Specification Qatar Engineering & Construction Company W. L. L. Structural Platforms and Wellhead Jackets; Structural Fabrication Drawings; Structural Design and Structural Adequacy Calculations; Lifting and Stacking Studies; Load-Out Procedure. - Experience in the preparation of Detailed Engineering deliverables related to Civil discipline, such as: Overall Site Plan and Plot Details; Site Development Plan and Area Statement; Site Grading and Levelling Plan; Civil G.A. Drawings; G.A. Drawings and Details of Buildings (Floor and Roof Plans and Details, Elevations and Sections, Architectural Details); G.A. Drawings and Details of RCC Tanks, Pits and Sumps; G.A. Drawings and Details of Pipe Supports, Racks and Sleepers; Foundation (Equipment, Storage Tanks, Pipe Supports) Drawings; Layout of Road and Road Markings; Drainage System Network and Details; G.A. and Details of Paving; Civil Design Calculations; Civil Bill of Materials; Specifications; Civil Scope of Work Documents; Scope of Work for Topographic Survey, Underground Services Survey and Geo-technical Investigation Study; As-built Drawings. - Experience in the preparation of Scope Matrix for Engineering Consultants; review of Structural / Civil Engineering deliverables prepared by Engineering Consultants for ensuring compliance with project, HSE, Quality and Code requirements. - Experience in pre-bid Engineering, technical support to Proposal Team. - Experience in the preparation of Scope of Work documents for ECS and EPIC Projects. - Good knowledge of Structural / Civil materials of construction. - Good exposure to Fabrication and Construction activities related to Structural and Civil. - Good interpersonal relationship capabilities and communication (oral and written). Leadership capabilities, team work and ability to coach, guide and motivate subordinates on the job

title: Instrumentation Engineer
full_description:
Job Scope:
Study and develop conceptual designs, prepare detailed engineering solutions, plan, monitor and coordinate all assigned modifications and projects in conjunction with project management and end user team for a wide range of tasks related to discipline scope. Act as a key focal point for discipline engineering aspects for the in-house engineering/subcontracted engineering and review the design/engineering work conducted in line with defined requirements, industry best practices and contractual agreements.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Description Project Management
 Act as a technical expert for all matters related to Instrumentation & Control systems across assigned projects, ensuring timely provision of efficient and reliable services to solve technical issues in the production plant.
 Support in efficient and cost-effective delivery of Instrumentation & Control systems services for assigned projects. Participate in costing and preparation of budgets for Instrumentation & Control systems engineering projects for QAPCO.
Carry out feasibility studies and comprehensive testing to support financial and technical viability of new Instrumentation & Control systems and provide recommendations as appropriate. Develop specifications of Instrumentation & Control systems associated with new projects.
Coordinate Instrumentation & Control systems engineering review and approval of design, equipment and interface with contractors and vendors on QAPCO's requirement.
Ensure projects' Instrumentation & Control systems engineering activities are executed according to specifications, within budget, with the contract scope of work and meets the time schedules while highlighting any non-conformances to the reporting QAPCO supervisor.
Gather and analyze pertinent data and information and prepare recommendations with supporting technical data for the effective development of specifications and equipment data sheets.
Design & Engineering:
Sets up and executes assigned engineering activities such as detailed design, verification and studies relevant to any engineering topic associated to discipline, pursuing objectives of sound engineering and design optimization in term of costs, fabrication simplicity and safety. 
Prepares design specifications for field instruments, PLC/DCS Control systems, Fire & Gas systems, analysers, Vibration monitoring systems etc.
Participate in technical discussions to resolve technical problems. Provide cost effective engineering solutions based on good engineering practices, codes and standards. 
Prepare orifice sizing calculations, control valve sizing calculations, thermo well wake frequency calculations etc.
Detailed engineering works such as preparation of instrument layouts, hook up drawings, loop drawings, wiring diagrams, cable schedule, interface drawings etc.
Prepare Instrumentation & Control systems specifications for Package items such as compressors, blowers, pumps, tanks etc.
Prepare PLC/DCS functional logic diagrams based on the Control Narrative, Cause & effect etc. 
Participate in LOPA analysis and HAZOP meetings.
Issue Purchase Requisitions and perform technical bid evaluations.
Prepares MTOs and BOQs.
Minimum Experience & Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Instrumentation & Control Engineering (full time course).
10 years' experience in the field of engineering in an engineering consultancy/Operating plant (Petrochemical/Oil & gas/Fertiliser) with at least 8 years in the design field of Petrochemical/Oil & gas/Fertiliser projects.
Team leadership responsibilities and exposure to Project management.
Proficiency in English language Job-Specific Skills (Generic / Technical):
Knowledge of Industrial Instrumentation & Control engineering 4 Classification:
Knowledge of Industrial Codes & Standards
Conceptual and analytical skills
Skill to resolve technical problems and provide quick and cost-effective engineering solutions based on good engineering practices.
Very good knowledge in the selection of flow, pressure, level and temperature instruments & Control valves for different applications,
Very good knowledge in instruments & control valve specifications and data sheets preparation
Experience in technical bid evaluation and technical recommendations.
Experience in the detailed engineering works such as preparation of instrument hook up drawings, loop drawings, wiring diagrams, cable schedule, interface drawings etc.  Experience in data sheet preparation and selection of instrument cables, instrument tubes & fittings, cable glands etc.
Experience in Package items engineering & vendor document review.
Good knowledge in DCS/PLC control systems, its architecture, networking and industrial communication protocols.  Experience in interlocks and functional logic preparation.  Experience in flow orifice sizing calculations, control valve sizing and thermo well Wake frequency calculations using relevant soft wares.  Good knowledge in Fire & Gas systems and its selection.  Reasonable knowledge in Fibre optic communications and its networking.
Reasonable knowledge in Liquid and Gas analysers.
Reasonable knowledge in Vibration monitoring systems, its selection and engineering.
Reasonable knowledge in Safety Instrumented Systems (SIS), SIL calculations and its relevant IEC codes.
Reasonable knowledge in LOPA analysis and HAZOP.
Good knowledge in relevant NFPA, ISA and IEC codes and standards.
Basic knowledge in Security management systems, CCTV systems and its networking.
Excellent communication and strong time management skills.
IT Proficiency.

title: FIELD SERVICE ENGINEER (MEDICAL EQUIPEMENT) IRELAND
full_description:
Our client is one of the world’s leading health care suppliers and is in the Top 20 ranking of Medical Devices Companies. The company employs over 68,000 people in 64 countries and is active in 18 therapy fields and applications with a focus on hospitals, medical practices, pharmacies, nursing, emergency services and at-home care. They are recognised as a Great Place to Work in Ireland and one with a mission to become the most progressive workplace in the life sciences industry.   They are seeking to recruit a FIELD SERVICE ENGINEER to join a team of 3 experienced engineers providing technical support to renal dialysis equipment. A structured training programme will be put in place for the successful candidate incorporating certified manufacturer training courses in conjunction with hands on experience working alongside senior engineers on customer sites. The engineer will be challenged in this role to develop and establish expertise in the company renal equipment and technology. This is a unique opportunity to work within a dynamic, collaborative, and professional engineering team with exposure to cooperate on projects with our international colleagues.
Reporting to: Healthcare Technology Manager
In this role your core responsibilities will include:
To engage in the technical repair, both preventative and corrective, of equipment at customer sites or other locations.
To advise and lead on the installation requirements for a renal dialysis unit.
To undertake technical and user support training (both locally and in Germany) for company products and any other relevant equipment.
To develop and maintain a level of technical competency to work independently and confidently.
Willingness to learn and embrace emerging technologies in the dynamic environment of modern medical devices.
To be commercially aware and market orientated.
Flexibility to travel to our customers throughout the 32 counties of Ireland.
To work as part of a team in the achievement of team/organisational objectives
To work with colleagues in the administration of spare parts stock and other record keeping duties.
To engage and understand the policies and procedures associated with the business.
To work with the team in any other activities which will benefit the team and the customer.
Key Skills:
Ensures attention to detail.
Contributes to the team, readily helps, or co-operates, encourages reasonable relationships within their team.
Demonstrates problem solving ability. Uses a structured problem-solving process to obtain results. Clearly identifies root causes of problems. Uses appropriate analyses to generate a variety of options. Evaluates solutions to determine the most suitable course of action.
Can build rapport. Is outgoing and positive to customers. Relates well to other members of the work team or customers. Displays enthusiasm and is understated in approach.
Is open and receptive to other people, picks up other peoples’ immediate feelings and emotions and can communicate basic information effectively and efficiently.
Can deal with several tasks at once, is able to cope with most normal situations, is seen as a reasonable individual capable of a healthy give and take relationship. Other individuals can present sensitive ideas in their presence. Is willing to compromise without compromising integrity.
Basic Requirements:
Qualified in electronic / electrical / mechanical / biomedical engineering or similar technical discipline
Strong I.T. and communication skills essential.  
Previous experience in renal technical services (maintenance & repair) and I.T. hardware is desirable and advantageous but not essential.
Comfortable working in a clinical setting and interacting with allied health professionals (e.g. nurses, doctors, biomed engineers)
Familiar with relevant E.U. Directives for medical devices, e.g. MDR, EN 60601, I.S.O. quality standards.
Full clean driving license
Flexible to travel regularly throughout Ireland, and further as the need arises

Demonstrates problem solving ability. Uses a structured problem-solving process to obtain results. Clearly identifies root causes of problems. Uses appropriate analyses to generate a variety of options. Evaluates solutions to determine the most suitable course of action.
Can build rapport. Is outgoing and positive to customers. Relates well to other members of the work team or customers. Displays enthusiasm and is understated in approach.
Is open and receptive to other people, picks up other peoples’ immediate feelings and emotions and can communicate basic information effectively and efficiently.
Can deal with several tasks at once, is able to cope with most normal situations, is seen as a reasonable individual capable of a healthy give and take relationship. Other individuals can present sensitive ideas in their presence. Is willing to compromise without compromising integrity.
Qualified in electronic / electrical / mechanical / biomedical engineering or similar technical discipline
Strong I.T. and communication skills essential.
Previous experience in renal technical services (maintenance & repair) and I.T. hardware is desirable and advantageous but not essential.
Comfortable working in a clinical setting and interacting with allied health professionals (e.g. nurses, doctors, biomed engineers)
Familiar with relevant E.U. Directives for medical devices, e.g. MDR, EN 60601, I.S.O. quality standards.
Full clean driving license
Flexible to travel regularly throughout Ireland, and further as the need arises

title: PAVEMENT ENGINEER : USA
full_description:
We are seeking to recruit on behalf of our client a PAVEMENT ENGINEER who will be based In Champaign, Illinois, USA on a long-term contract, an experienced and highly skilled Senior Pavement Engineer to lead and manage our pavement engineering projects with a focus on pavement management systems (PMS).
The successful candidate will have a strong technical background in both empirical and mechanistic-empirical pavement design, and will be responsible for overseeing pavement evaluations, preparing detailed technical reports, and guiding decision-making processes through the development of deterioration models and fine-tuning decision trees, building the department and winning work and growing the business.
In this role, you will be responsible for conducting pavement evaluations, interpreting test data, and working with advanced pavement analysis tools. You will also collaborate with cross-functional teams and external stakeholders to ensure high-quality outcomes in line with international standards.
  Key Responsibilities:
Leadership & Project Management: Lead and manage pavement engineering projects from conception to completion, ensuring adherence to quality, budget, and timelines.
Pavement Design: Develop both empirical and mechanistic-empirical pavement designs for a variety of pavement types and conditions, ensuring alignment with industry best practices and standards.
Pavement Management Systems (PMS): Utilize your expertise in PMS to develop, calibrate, and implement pavement deterioration models and decision trees.
Data Interpretation: Conduct and interpret data from destructive and non-destructive testing methods such as FWD (Falling Weight Deflectometer), GPR (Ground Penetrating Radar), Friction Tester, and LCMS-2. Provide training to junior engineers on equipment use and data interpretation.
Prepare detailed technical reports, proposals, and bids that clearly outline project methodologies, results, and recommendations for clients.
Software Utilization: Utilize advanced pavement analysis software to support project development and analysis. Stay updated on new software advancements and implement where appropriate.
Ensure all designs and recommendations comply with international standards such as FAA AC’s, ICAO, GACA, Saudi ARAMCO, AASHTO, and DMRB.
Communicate effectively with clients, government agencies, and other stakeholders. Provide technical advice and ensure that
client requirements are fully understood and met.
Stay current with industry developments and innovations in pavement engineering and apply this knowledge to improve the company’s services.
  Minimum Requirements:
Experience: 10+ years of experience in pavement engineering, with a focus on pavement management systems (PMS) and leadership roles.
Proficient in developing and calibrating deterioration models and fine-tuning decision trees.
Strong background in both empirical and mechanistic-empirical pavement design.
Solid experience in interpreting data from FWD, GPR, Friction Tester, and LCMS-2.
Familiarity with key industry standards (FAA ACs, ICAO, GACA, Saudi ARAMCO, AASHTO, DMRB).
Skilled in using popular pavement analysis software.
Ability to interpret results from destructive and non-destructive testing methods.
Reporting & Bid Preparation: Proven ability to prepare bids and write comprehensive technical reports.
Training Capabilities: Capable of providing training and guidance to junior engineers on data interpretation and the use of technical equipment.
Educational Background:
Professional Engineer (PE) license.
MSCE (Master of Science in Civil Engineering), ME (Master of Engineering), or Ph.D. in a relevant field, preferably from the US, Europe, or UK.
Programming Skills: Proficiency in programming languages relevant to pavement design and analysis.
Software Knowledge: Familiarity with commercial pavement design and evaluation software.
Flexibility & Collaboration: Willingness to travel to different company branches and work closely with other team leaders to drive project success
requirements: Flexibility & Collaboration: Willingness to travel to different company branches and work closely with other team leaders to drive project success

title: Welding Engineer
full_description:
Job Opportunity: Welding Engineer (Offshore & Pipeline Expertise)
We are looking for a highly qualified Welding Engineer with extensive experience in the oil and gas industry. This role focuses on offshore projects, including platforms, jackets, topsides, and pipeline systems. The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background in welding engineering, materials science, and mechanical engineering, along with significant offshore experience.
Key Qualifications:
A Bachelor's degree in Metallurgical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related discipline.
A minimum of 10 years of experience in the oil and gas sector, particularly with offshore projects (platforms, topsides, jackets) and pipeline systems.
Expertise in corrosion-resistant materials and welding processes used in offshore environments.
Certifications:
International Welding Engineer (IWE) certification.
Certified Welding Inspector (CSWIP) certification.
American Society for Nondestructive Testing (ASNT) certification.
Core Responsibilities:
Offshore Expertise: Strong knowledge and experience with offshore installations, including welding and materials specifications for jackets, platforms, and pipeline systems.
WPS/PQR Review: Review and validate Welding Procedure Specifications (WPS) and Procedure Qualification Records (PQR) to ensure full compliance with engineering standards and industry regulations.
Inspection & Integrity: Conduct detailed inspections to ensure the integrity and compliance of welding procedures, materials, and structures.
Collaboration: Work closely with project teams to provide technical guidance on welding, materials selection, and integrity management for offshore and pipeline projects.
This position offers the opportunity to work on high-level offshore projects and to contribute technical expertise to ensure project quality and safety. If you are a qualified Welding Engineer with the right skills and experience, we invite you to apply.
responsibilities: This position offers the opportunity to work on high-level offshore projects and to contribute technical expertise to ensure project quality and safety. If you are a qualified Welding Engineer with the right skills and experience, we invite you to apply.

title: Procurement QC Engineer
full_description:
Job Title: Source Inspection Coordinator / Procurement Quality Engineer
Job Description:
We are looking for an experienced Source Inspection Coordinator / Procurement Quality Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in the oil and gas sector, with a focus on offshore projects, CRA, and EPC (Engineering, Procurement, and Construction) projects. This position requires a highly skilled individual with a comprehensive understanding of procurement quality assurance processes, vendor coordination, and inspection management.
Key Responsibilities:
Manage coordination with vendors to ensure compliance with quality standards.
Review requisitions, technical bid evaluations (TBEs), and vendor deliverables.
Oversee, monitor, and coordinate vendor and third-party inspection (TPI) activities.
Resolve procurement-related quality issues in collaboration with clients.
Issue Inspection Release Notes (IRN) to authorize the release of items from the manufacturer’s location.
Review and manage the Material Review Board (MRB) process, ensuring timely delivery and client approval.
Provide inputs and analysis for procurement-related Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
Required Qualifications and Skills:
Bachelor of Science (BSc) in Mechanical Engineering.
10-15 years of experience in the oil and gas industry, including offshore and CRA projects.
ISO 9001:2015 certification (Quality Management Systems).
Preferred qualifications: CSWIP (Certified Welding Inspector) and ASNT (American Society for Nondestructive Testing) certifications.
Extensive experience with EPC projects and vendor management in the oil and gas sector.
Strong understanding of procurement processes and quality control procedures.
Additional Information:
This position offers an exciting opportunity to work with a dynamic team in a fast-paced industry.
Competitive compensation package and benefits.

title: RUYA B1 PVV Engineer
full_description:
We are looking for a RUYA B1 PVV Engineer for one of our clients with the following details:
Start Date: 01-Jan-2025
End Date: 31-Dec-2026
Location: Doha/Korea
SINGLE status, Residential/Onshore
Qualifications & Experience Required
Qualification: Engineering degree in mechanical engineering.
Experience: Minimum 15 years' experience as mechanical/ PVV engineer in Oil and Gas industry.
Knowledge in piping components, valves, pressure vessels, PDMS, welding, metallurgy, piping codes (ASME, API, ASTM),
Experience in design and fabrication of static equipment's (pressure vessels, heat exchangers etc) with relevant experience within the offshore oil and gas production industry
Knowledge of various process and utility equipment including interface requirements with vendors of proprietary equipment/ items
Experience in handling process and utility packages typically required for process platform.
Understanding of process/ utility systems and associated multi-disciplinary interface requirements.

Experience in procurement engineering including material requisition, vendor evaluation/ recommendation, purchase requisition along with vendor document review.

Computer literate, especially in in MS Office, PVElite, and COMPRESS
Strong leadership skills and good communication skills.

Work with weight control engineer and engineering team to ensure close weight monitoring and control of weight.
Contribute to the proper realization of the identification of and specification of the LLI.
Ensure close coordination with other disciplines on all engineering, constructability, and operational matters,
Ensure that relevant feedback/lesson learned from previous similar projects are considered in the design performance.
Work closely with AVEVA 3D model admin and PMD Coordinators on development of design layout and
Assist in planning and preparation of PVV discipline kick-off meeting with EPC Contractor
Support procurement engineering including TBEs and vendor documents review, and assist in manufacture site visit.
Support fabrication and construction engineering on review of engineering documents, modification approval, non-conformity reviews and assist in closer of punch lists.
Support project during installation and hookup stage and review/approval work-pack, review of red-marks
Thorough, efficient, and timely review of project PVV discipline documents, realization of potential derogations to the standards, and challenge the design to achieve an optimize and fit for purpose outcome.
Ensure project documents related to the PVV(related to Static and packaged Equipment) discipline are reviewed and commented in a timely manner and in accordance with the company standards, project specification and contractual requirements.
Identify any optimization / improvement in the design dossier to be implemented in the early stage of detailed design, promote, and encourage submissions of value engineering proposals.
Promote fit for purpose design to reduce and to optimize planning and costs,
Ensure as far as possible standardization of design proposals for wellhead platforms.
Coordinate and issue project response to contractors and vendors requests on engineering design clarifications and TQR.
Identify the protentional deviations/derogations to the client to and assist in preparation of deviation package.
Consult E&C department to process derogation requests and interface with relevant TRP to secure needed approvals.
Review of final project documentation including final dossiers and as-built drawings.
Assisting to project studies and meetings related to the PVV discipline as per project approved gate levels and design maturity.
Assist PVV Lead to define, follow up and evaluate the PVV discipline studies related to Static and packaged Equipment to be carried out by Contractors, ensure the studies completed as per approved project gate and maturity.
Assist in preparation and attend to project studies including model review, HAZID, HAZOP, constructability review, PRs.
Provide technical answers and clarifications to internal project audit sessions (PR, HAZOP, HAZID, etc....).
Participate in weekly PVV engineering meetings with Contractors, and in specific ad hoc meetings as required by management.
Assist in preparation of engineering progress reports detailing PVV discipline progress across schedule. risks and technical issues to ensure accurate and timely information available to Package Management Team
Identifying potential risks and scope changes within the PVV discipline, conducting initial impact assessment to provide detailed information to PVV Lead.
Identify potential engineering scope change related to PVV discipline, carry out initial technical assessment in order to provide accurate information to PVV Lead.
Ensure the design follows the approved SOR, basis of design and project standards, captured and manage any changes as per project change management plan.

title: Lead Planning Engineer
full_description:
Job Title: Lead Planning Engineer
Client: Large global engineering consultancy doing a project in South East Asia
Location:Must be based in Jakarta
Job Overview:
The Lead Planning Engineer will be responsible for providing all planning and scheduling services during the FEED phase of the project. This role is pivotal in ensuring the timely, efficient, and successful completion of the project by developing, maintaining, and reporting on project schedules. The Lead Planning Engineer will work closely with other disciplines, perform risk analysis, and ensure alignment on project priorities to meet COMPANY's internal requirements and project objectives.
Key Responsibilities:
Schedule Development: Prepare an integrated FEED Study schedule to identify key activities, critical work sequences, and overall duration to ensure successful project completion. Interface with other studies or surveys to ensure all aspects of the project are aligned.
Progress Monitoring: Update the integrated FEED Study Schedule monthly to report progress to COMPANY, identifying any deviations from the plan and recommending corrective actions.
Project Execution Planning: Develop an Integrated Overall Project Execution Schedule, highlighting key activities and critical work sequences to ensure timely and successful project delivery.
Risk Analysis: Conduct schedule risk analysis when necessary to identify potential project delays or issues and develop mitigation strategies.
Interface Scheduling: Develop and maintain project interface schedules, ensuring the proper status reporting of interfaces between CONTRACTOR and COMPANY.
Progress Reporting: Develop and maintain the overall project progress reporting system, coordinating progress reporting to COMPANY on a regular basis.
Risk Reviews: Participate in regular risk reviews within CONTRACTOR's organization, ensuring any potential project risks are identified and managed.
HSSE Engagement: Actively engage in HSSE leadership, awareness, and training programs to promote a strong safety culture on the project.
Coordination: Work closely with other CONTRACTOR disciplines to ensure alignment on project priorities, avoiding conflicts and promoting smooth project execution.
Specialist Recommendations: Provide recommendations to the Project Controls Manager regarding any specialized input or resources required to meet project objectives.
Required Qualifications and Experience:
Education:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent in a relevant field.
Experience:
Minimum of 15 years of experience in the oil and gas industry.
At least 10 years of experience in project planning and scheduling.
At least 5 years of experience in a Lead Planning Engineer role.
Significant experience in FEED and EPCI phases for offshore pipeline or equivalent projects.
Proven track record in planning large-scale projects within the oil and gas industry.
Demonstrated capability in planning and scheduling services for worldwide projects with a major engineering contractor.
Technical Expertise: Extensive experience in project controls functions within the oil and gas or petrochemical industries.
Software Proficiency: Hands-on experience using project control systems and software applications such as Primavera v6 and PertMaster.
Project Specific Experience: Demonstrated experience in planning pipeline or equivalent projects, with the ability to list project names and phases.
Skills and Competencies:
In-depth knowledge of project planning and scheduling techniques.
Ability to develop and manage integrated project schedules.
Strong understanding of risk management and scheduling analysis.
Proven ability to work with diverse teams and coordinate project activities.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to report on schedule progress to internal and external stakeholders.
Leadership abilities with a focus on safety, planning, and effective resource management.
